perryville missouri municipal code ____________ a codification of the general ordinances of perryville missouri ____________ beginning with supp no 14 supplemented by municipal ____________ > preface the perryville missouri municipal originally published by book publishing company has been kept current by regular supplementation by municipal its successor in interest during original codification the ordinances were compiled edited and indexed by the editorial staff of book publishing company under the direction of marilyn dobbelare city clerk the code is organized by subject matter under an expandable threefactor decimal numbering system which is designed to facilitate supplementation without disturbing the numbering of existing provisions each section number designates in sequence the numbers of the title chapter and section thus located in of title 2 in most instances sections are numbered by tens 010 020 030 etc leaving nine vacant positions between original sections to accommodate future provisions similarly chapters and titles are numbered to provide for internal expansion in parentheses following each section is a legislative history identifying the specific sources for the provisions of that section this legislative history is complemented by an ordinance disposition table following the text of the code listing by number all ordinances their subjects and where they appear in the codification  and beginning with supplement no 14 legislation can be tracked using the table and disposition list a subjectmatter index with complete crossreferencing locates specific code provisions by individual section numbers this supplement brings the to date no passed  municipal capital circle sw tallahassee fl 32310 8002622633 how to use your code this code is organized to make the laws of the city as accessible as possible to city officials city employees and private citizens please take a moment to familiarize yourself with some of the important elements of this code numbering system the numbering system is the backbone of a ordinances  municipal uses a unique and versatile numbering structure that allows for easy expansion and amendment of this is based on three tiers beginning with title then chapter and ending with section each part is represented in the code section number for example in of title 2 title a title is a broad category under which ordinances on a related subject are compiled this code contains about 15 to 20 titles for example the first title is title 1 general provisions which may contain ordinances about the general penalty code adoption and definitions the titles in this code are separated by tabbed divider pages for quick reference some titles are reserved for later use deal with more specific subjects and are often derived from one ordinance all of the chapters on a related subject are grouped in one title the chapters are numbered so that new chapters which should logically be placed near certain existing chapters can be added at a later time without renumbering existing material for example city manager can be added between 204 city council and city attorney section of the code contains substantive ordinance material the sections are numbered by tens to allow for expansion of the code without renumbering tables of contents there are many tables of contents in this code to assist in locating specific information at the beginning of the code is the main table of contents listing each title in addition each title and chapter has its own table of contents listing the chapters and sections respectively note at the end of each code section you will find an ordinance history note which lists the underlying ordinances for that section the ordinances are listed by number section if applicable and year example  1992 beginning with supplement no 14 a secondary ordinance history note will be appended to affected sections notes will be amended with the most recent ordinance added to the end these history notes can be cross referenced to the code comparative table and disposition list appearing at the back of the volume preceding the index statutory references the statutory references direct the code user to those portions of the state statutes that are applicable to the laws of the municipality as the statutes are revised these references will be updated crossreference table when a code is based on an earlier codification the crossreference table will help users find older or prior code references in the new code the crossreference table is located near the end of the code under the tabbed divider tables this table lists the prior code section in the column labeled prior  and the new code section in the column labeled herein disposition table to find a specific ordinance in the code turn to the section called tables for the disposition table this very useful table tells you the status of every ordinance reviewed for inclusion in the code the table is organized by ordinance number and provides a brief description and the disposition of the ordinance if the ordinance is codified the chapter or chapters will be indicated example 204 612 904 if the ordinance is of a temporary nature or deals with subjects not normally codified such as budgets taxes annexations or rezones the disposition will be special if the ordinance is for some reason omitted from the code usually at the direction of the municipality the disposition will be not codified other dispositions sometimes used are tabled pending number not used or missing index if you are not certain where to look for a particular subject in this code start with the index this is an alphabetical multitier subject index which uses section numbers as the reference and crossreferences where necessary look for the main heading of the subject you need then the appropriate subheadings business license see also business tax fee  required when  the index will be updated as necessary when the code text is amended instruction sheet each supplement to the new code will be accompanied by an instruction sheet the instruction sheet will tell the code user the date of the most recent supplement and the last ordinance contained in that supplement it will then list the pages that must be pulled from the code and the new pages that must be inserted following these instructions carefully will assure that the code is kept accurate and current removed pages should be kept for future reference page numbers when originally published the pages of this code were consecutively numbered as of supplement no __ when new pages are inserted with amendments the pages will follow a point numbering system example 32 321 322   33 backs of pages that are blank in codes that are printed doublesided will be left unnumbered but the number will be reserved for later use electronic submission in the interests of accuracy and speed we encourage you to submit your ordinances electronically if at all possible we can accept most any file format including word wordperfect or text files if you have a choice we prefer word any version you can send files to us as an email attachment by ftp on a diskette or cdrom electronic files enable us not only to get you your code more quickly but also ensure that it is errorfree our email address is ords@municodecom for hard copy send two copies of all ordinances passed to municipal po box 2235 tallahassee fl 32316 customer service if you have any questions about this code or our services please contact municipal at 18002622633 or municipal capital 34 6136  include 34 6141  include 34 title 1  general provisions chapters code adoption adoption there is adopted the perryville municipal  as compiled edited and published by book publishing company seattle washington  1999   titlecitationreference this code shall be known as the perryville municipal  and it shall be sufficient to refer to said code as the perryville municipal  in any prosecution for the violation of any provision of this code or in any proceeding at law or equity it is sufficient to designate any ordinance adding to amending correcting or repealing all or any part or portion of this code as an addition to amendment to correction or repeal of the perryville municipal  references may be made to the titles chapters sections and subsections of the perryville municipal  and such references shall apply to those titles chapters sections or subsections as they appear in the code  1999   reference applies to all amendments whenever a reference is made to this code as the perryville municipal  or to any portion thereof or to any ordinance of the city of perryville missouri codified herein the reference shall apply to all amendments corrections and additions heretofore now or hereafter made  1999   title chapter and section headings title chapter and section headings contained in this code shall not be deemed to govern limit modify or in any manner affect the scope meaning or intent of the provisions of any title chapter or section in this code  1999   reference to specific ordinances the provisions of this code shall not in any manner affect matters of record which refer to or are otherwise connected with ordinances which are therein specifically designated by number or otherwise and which are included within the code but such reference shall be construed to apply to the corresponding provisions contained within this code  1999   ordinances passed prior to adoption of the code the last ordinance included in this code was passed  the following ordinances passed subsequent to but prior to adoption of this code are adopted and made a part of this code ordinances 3770 passed after  and prior to   1999   effect of code on past actions and obligations the adoption of this code does not affect prosecutions for ordinance violations committed prior to the effective date of this code does not waive any fee or penalty due and unpaid on the effective date of this code and does not affect the validity of any bond or cash deposit posted filed or deposited pursuant to the requirements of any ordinance  1999   constitutionality if any section subsection sentence clause or phrase of this code is for any reason held to be invalid or unconstitutional such decision shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions of this code  1999   references to prior code references in city forms documents and regulations to the chapters and sections of the former city code shall be construed to apply to the corresponding provisions contained within this code  1999 general provisions designated and cited the ordinances embraced in the following chapters shall constitute and be designated the perryville municipal  and may be so cited    rules of construction in the construction of this code and of all ordinances the following rules shall be observed unless such construction would be inconsistent with the manifest intent of the board of aldermen alderman means any person who is a member of the board of aldermen of the city of perryville board of aldermen or board unless the context requires otherwise shall be construed to refer to the board of aldermen of the city of perryville city means the city of perryville in the state of missouri ordinances municipal code or code means the perryville municipal computation of time means the time within which an act is to be done shall be computed by excluding the first and including the last day  and if the last day is sunday or a legal holiday that day shall be excluded county the county or this county means the county of perry in the state of missouri delegation of authority whenever a provision appears requiring the head of a department of the city to do some act or make certain inspections it shall be construed to authorize the head of the department to designate delegate and authorize subordinates to perform the required act or make the required inspection unless the terms of the provision designate otherwise gender a word importing the masculine gender only shall extend and be applied to females and to firms partnerships and corporations as well as to males joint authority words importing joint authority to three or more persons shall be construed as authority to a majority of such persons mayor means the mayor of the city of perryville month means a calendar month name of officer whenever the name of an officer is given it shall be construed as though the words of the city of perryville were added nontechnical and technical words words and phrases shall be construed according to the common and approved usage of the language  but technical words and phrases and such others as may have acquired a peculiar and appropriate meaning in law shall be construed and understood according to such meaning number a word importing the singular number only may extend and be applied to several persons and things as well as to one person and thing oath includes an affirmation in all cases in which by law an affirmation may be substituted for an oath and in such cases the words swear and sworn shall be equivalent to the words affirm and affirmed or and or may be read and and and may be read or if the sense requires it owner when applied to a building or land includes any part owner joint owner tenant in common tenant in partnership  joint tenant or tenant by the entirety of the whole or of a part of such building or land person shall extend and be applied to associations clubs societies firms partnerships and bodies politic and corporate as well as to individuals personal property includes every species of property except real property as herein defined preceding following the words preceding and following shall mean next before and next after respectively premises means place or places property includes real and personal property public place means any public street park airport cemetery school yard public library building and area owned or used by the city or open space adjacent thereto real property includes lands tenements and hereditaments residence means the place adopted by a person as his place of habitation and to which whenever he is absent he has the intention of returning when a person eats at one place and sleeps at another the place where such person sleeps shall be deemed his residence seal means the city or corporate seal shall the word shall whenever used in this code shall be construed as being mandatory sidewalk means the portion of the street between the curbline and the adjacent property line intended for the use of pedestrians excluding parkways signature or subscription of a person shall include a mark when the person cannot write state the state or this state means the state of missouri street includes streets avenues boulevards roads alleys lanes viaducts and all other public highways in the city tenant or occupant applied to a building or land shall include any person who occupies the whole or a part of such building or land whether alone or with others tense words used in the past or present tense include the future as well as the past and present week means seven days written or in writing includes any representation of words letters or figures whether by printing or otherwise year means a calendar year    catchlines the catchlines of the several sections of this code printed in boldface type are intended as mere catchwords to indicate the contents of the section and shall not be deemed or taken to be titles of such sections nor as any part of the sections nor unless expressly so provided shall they be so deemed when any of such sections including the catchlines are amended or reenacted    effect of repeal of ordinances a the repeal of an ordinance shall not revive any ordinances in force before or at the time the ordinance repealed took effect b the repeal of an ordinance shall not affect any punishment or penalty incurred before the repeal took effect nor any suit prosecution or proceeding pending at the time of the repeal for an offense committed or cause of action arising under the ordinance repealed    severability of code it is declared to be the intention of the board of aldermen that the sections paragraphs sentences clauses and phrases of this code are severable and if any phrase clause sentence paragraph or section of this code shall be declared unconstitutional by the valid judgment or decree of any court of competent jurisdiction such unconstitutionality shall not affect any of the remaining phrases clauses sentences paragraphs and sections of this code since the same would have been enacted by the board of aldermen without the incorporation in this code of any such unconstitutional phrase clause sentence paragraph or section    amendments to code a all ordinances passed subsequent to this code which amend repeal or in any way affect this code may be numbered in accordance with the numbering system of this code and printed for inclusion therein or in the case of repealed chapters sections and subsections or any part thereof by subsequent ordinances such repealed portions may be excluded from the code by omission from reprinted pages affected thereby and the subsequent ordinances as numbered and printed or omitted in the case of repeal shall be prima facie evidence of such subsequent ordinances until such time that this code and subsequent ordinances numbered or omitted are readopted as a new code of ordinances by the board of aldermen b amendments to any of the provisions of this code should be made by amending such provisions by specific reference to the section of this code in substantially the following language that section _______ of the ordinances of the city of perryville missouri is hereby amended to read as follows  set out new provisions in full  c in the event a new section not heretofore existing in the code is to be added the following language may be used that the ordinances of the city of perryville missouri is hereby amended by adding a section or article chapter or other designation as the case may be to be numbered _______ which reads as followsset out new provisions in full d in lieu of the foregoing paragraph when the board of aldermen desires to enact an ordinance of a general and permanent nature embracing a subject not previously existing in the code which the board of aldermen desires to incorporate into the code a provision in substantially the following language may be made a part of the ordinance it is the intention of the board of aldermen and it is hereby ordained that the provisions of this ordinance shall become and be made part of the ordinances of the city of perryville missouri and the sections of this ordinance may be renumbered to accomplish such intention e all sections articles chapters or other provisions of this code desired to be repealed should be specifically repealed by section number article number chapter or other number as the case may be    altering code it is unlawful for any person in the city to change or amend by additions or deletions any part or portion of this code or to insert or delete pages or portions thereof or to alter or tamper with such code in any manner whatsoever which will cause the law of the city of perryville to be misrepresented thereby any person firm or corporation violating this section shall be punished as provided in  city seal description the seal of the city shall be as follows in the center shall be the words city seal in large letters surrounded with a circular scroll  outside of such scroll in circular form shall be the words city of perryville perry county mo in roman capitals and outside of this shall be another circular scroll  elections wards of city established the city is divided into the following three wards precincts 1 ward no l ward no 1 shall include all of the territory bound on the west by main street and north of kingshighway from its intersection with main street northwest to the existing city limits and further bound on the north east and south by the existing city limits 2 ward no 2 ward no 2 shall include all of the territory bound on the east by main street and on the north by u s highway 61 north kingshighway and on the west by the city limits and on the south by st joseph street except all of the territory bound on the west by bruce street and on the east by school street and on the north by grand avenue and on the south by st joseph street 3 ward no 3 ward no 3 shall include all of the territory bound on the east by main street and on the south by the city limits and on the west by the city limits and on the north by st joseph street also all of the territory bound on the west by bruce street and on the east by school street and on the north by grand avenue and on the south by st joseph street  2001   62111   date of general election a general election for the elective officers of this city shall be held on the first tuesday after the first monday in april of each year a on the first tuesday after the first monday in april of evennumbered years an election shall be held by the qualified voters of each ward in the city for mayor for police judge and for one alderman for each ward who shall hold their respective offices for the term of two years and until their successors shall be elected and qualified b on the first tuesday after the first monday in april of oddnumbered years an election shall be held by the qualified voters of each ward of this city for one alderman for each ward who shall hold their respective offices for the term of two years and until their successors shall be elected and qualified c on the first tuesday after the first monday in april of evennumbered years an election shall be held by the qualified voters of each ward of this city for the chief of police who shall hold his office for a term of four years and until his successor shall be elected and qualified  1997 prior code  102  41916   declaration of candidacy a any person desiring to seek election for any elective office at any general city election may do so by filing a declaration of candidacy with the city clerk between eight am on the sixteenth tuesday prior to the election and five pm on the eleventh tuesday prior to the election any candidate for elective city office at any general city election must file within this time period the city clerk shall before the sixteenth tuesday prior to any election at which offices are to be filed notify the general public of the opening filing date the office or offices to be filled the proper place for filing and the closing filing date of the election such notification shall be accomplished by a legal notice published in at least one newspaper of general circulation in the city the city clerk shall keep a permanent record of the names of the candidates the office for which they seek election and the dates of the filings  and their names shall appear on the ballots in said order b the aforesaid declaration of candidacy shall contain the full name of the candidate his address and age the office for which he proposes to be a candidate the date of the filing and if nominated and elected to such office that the candidate will qualify such declaration of candidacy shall be in substantially the following form i the undersigned a resident and qualified elector in ward no_______ of the city of perryville residing at ________ street in said city in the county of perry and state of missouri do announce myself a candidate for the office of ________ to be voted for at an election to be held on the first tuesday in april ________ and i further declare that if nominated and elected to such office i will qualify dated ________s________  2007  prior code  103   filing fee every candidate for the city office shall at the time he files his declaration of candidacy pay filing fee of twentyfive dollars $2500 to the city clerk who shall deposit the same in the general revenue fund of the city    disqualification for delinquent taxes a in addition to other qualifications for elective office set forth in this code any person who files as a candidate for election to a municipal office shall be disqualified from participation in the election for which the candidate has filed if such person is delinquent in the payment of any state income taxes personal property taxes municipal taxes real property taxes on the place of residence as stated on the declaration of candidacy or if the person is a past or present corporate officer of any fee office that owes any taxes to the state b each potential candidate for election to a municipal office shall file an affidavit with the missouri department of revenue as required under the revised statutes of missouri and include a copy of the affidavit with the declaration of candidacy required under this code the city clerk shall without further investigation be authorized to rely on said affidavit which shall be in substantially the following form affirmation of tax payments and bonding requirements i hereby declare under penalties of perjury that i am not currently aware of any delinquency in the filing or payment of any state income taxes personal property taxes municipal taxes real property taxes on the place of residence as stated on the declaration of candidacy or that i am a past or present corporate officer of any fee office that owes any taxes to the state other than those taxes which may be in dispute i declare under penalties of perjury that i am not aware of any information that would prohibit me from fulfilling any bonding requirements for the office for which i am filing ___________ candidates signature ___________ printed name of candidate c complaints alleging a delinquency of the candidate in the filing or payment of any state incomes taxes personal property taxes municipal taxes or real property taxes on the place of residence as stated on the declaration of candidacy shall be made to the missouri department of revenue and shall be investigated by the missouri department of revenue as set forth in the revised statutes of missouri the city clerk shall not be required to take any action until such time as the city clerk is notified by the missouri department of revenue that the candidate has failed to comply with the revised statutes of missouri  2007  prior code  105  11514   12115   challenge to candidates qualifications in the event that the city clerk determines that a candidate is not qualified for office as provided in this code or if a written affidavit is filed with the city clerk that a named candidate is not qualified for the office sought then the board of aldermen shall hold a hearing to determine the candidates qualifications except that in the event the missouri department of revenue has determined that the candidate is not qualified then no hearing is necessary if the board of aldermen determines that a candidate is not qualified for office as provided in this code the county clerk shall be notified and the candidates name shall be removed from the ballot unless the candidate seeks and receives an order from a court of competent jurisdiction that the decision of the board of aldermen is incorrect  11514   withdrawal of candidacydeadlineprocedure a any person who has filed a declaration of candidacy for elective office and wishes to withdraw as a candidate shall at such time as may be established in the revised statutes of missouri or no later than five pm on the sixth tuesday before the general election for which he has filed file a written sworn statement of withdrawal in the presence of the city clerk b the name of a person who has properly filed a declaration of candidacy or who has not given notice of withdrawal as provided in subsection a of this section shall except in case of death or disqualification be printed on the official general election ballot  2007   1998  prior code  106   conformance of city elections with state law all city elections shall be conducted and held in conformance with the provisions of a comprehensive election act of 1977    conduct of election by county clerk whenever an overlapping political subdivision conducts an election on the same day as the city election the county clerk as the designated election authority shall conduct the city election    conduct of election by city clerk a if there is no overlapping political subdivision conducting an election on the same day as the city election and if directed to do so by the board of aldermen or by appropriate election ordinance passed prior to five pm on the tenth tuesday prior to the city election and if the notification is timely received by the county clerk the city clerk shall conduct the city election in accordance with the appropriate provisions of the act b unless the board of aldermen by an appropriate election ordinance directs the city clerk to conduct an election when there is no overlapping political subdivision conducting an election on the same the county clerk shall conduct the city election as made and provided in the act  part 1998 prior code  109   notice of city election in city elections conducted by the county clerk the city clerk shall notify the county clerk prior to five pm on the tenth tuesday prior to any city election of the forthcoming city election the notice shall be in writing and shall specify that the city is calling the election the purposes of the election the date of the election and shall include a certified copy of the legal notice to be published and the sample ballot  part 1998 prior code  1010   voters qualifications all residents of the city who are qualified timely and properly registered voters in accordance with the comprehensive election act shall be entitled to vote in the city election in order to vote at any city election a person must be registered no later than five pm on the fourth wednesday prior to the election    designation of polling places and judgeselection cost the election authority shall designate the polling places in all city elections in accordance with the provisions of the comprehensive election act the election authority shall appoint all election judges in accordance with the provisions of said act the city shall pay all election costs as required by said act to the election authority conducting its election    assistance of city police officers it shall be the duty of city police officers to give any assistance or protection required by the election authority any employee of the election authority or any election judge and to comply with all lawful requests and directions of the election authority relating to such assistance    special election dates special election dates for the city shall be established in accordance with of the revised statutes of missouri  1997 prior code  1014   vacancies in the event a vacancy occurs in any elective office of the city the vacancy shall be filled in accordance with as amended    certification of election result as soon as practicable after each city election the election authority shall convene a verification board in accordance with the comprehensive election act to verify the account and certify the results of the election not later than the second tuesday after the election the verification board shall issue a statement announcing the results of each election and shall certify the returns to the city clerk the city clerk shall issue to each person elected a certificate of election    election ordinance prior to each city election the board of aldermen shall timely pass an election ordinance authorizing establishing and providing the election procedure to be followed in the conduct of the city election    tie vote in general and special elections if two or more persons receive an equal number of votes for election to an elective office the board of aldermen at its next regularly scheduled meeting shall choose one of such persons for the office    elected official to be installed in office upon qualification for office and certification of the election results as provided herein any candidate for elective office receiving the highest number of votes at any regular or special election shall be installed in said office  general penalty general penaltycontinuing violations a whenever in this code or in any ordinance or resolution of the city any act is prohibited or is made or declared to be unlawful or an offense or a misdemeanor or whenever in such code ordinance or resolution the doing of any act is required or the failure to do any act is declared to be unlawful or an offense or a misdemeanor where no specific penalty is provided therefor the violation of any such provision of this code ordinance or resolution shall be punished by a fine of not exceeding five hundred dollars $50000 and costs or by imprisonment in the city prison not exceeding three months or by both such fine and imprisonment  provided however that in any case wherein the penalty for an offense is fixed by state law or statute the same penalty so fixed by state law or statute shall be imposed for the punishments of such offense and no other except that imprisonments when made under this section may be in the city jail or the county jail b each day any violation of any provision of this code or of any such ordinance or resolution shall continue shall constitute a separate offense    parties to an offense every person who commits attempts to commit conspires to commit or aids or abets in the commission of any act declared herein to be unlawful or an offense or a misdemeanor whether individually or in connection with one or more other persons or as principal agent or accessory shall be guilty of such unlawful act or offense or misdemeanor and every person who falsely fraudulently forcibly or wilfully induces causes coerces requires permits or directs another to violate any provision hereof shall likewise be guilty    acts punishable under different sections in all cases where the same offense is made punishable or is created by different clauses or sections of this code the prosecuting officer may elect under which to proceed  but not more than one recovery shall be had against the same person for the same offense provided that the revocation of a license or permit shall not be considered a recovery or penalty so as to bar any other penalty being enforced  title 2  administration and personnel board of aldermen composition the board of aldermen shall consist of six members two of whom shall be chosen from each ward of the city in accordance with the provisions of the laws of this state governing cities of the fourth class    qualifications of members a no person shall be an alderman unless he is at least twentyone 21 years of age a citizen of the united states an inhabitant and resident of the city for one year next preceding his election a resident of the ward from which he is elected and a qualified voter under the laws and constitution of this state and the ordinances of the city b no person shall be an alderman who shall at the time of his election be in arrears for any unpaid city taxes or forfeiture or defalcation in office c no person shall be an alderman who has been found guilty of or pled guilty to a felony or misdemeanor under the federal laws of the united states or to a felony under the laws of this state or an offense committed in another state that would be considered a felony in this state d no person shall be an alderman who has not filed a candidates affidavit of tax payments and bonding requirements with the missouri department of revenue form 5120 as required by rsmo   12115   compensation each member of the board of aldermen shall receive as compensation the sum of three thousand six hundred dollars $360000 per year payable quarterly for performing the duties of office    resignations of members resignations of aldermen shall be in writing and addressed to the president of the board of aldermen    procedure for appointing city officers the board of aldermen shall in electing any person to fill any office of the city vote by ayes and nays and the result thereof shall be entered upon the journal of the proceedings of the board in all cases it shall require a majority vote of all the members of the board of aldermen for any person to be appointed to such office    authority to fix compensation of city officers and employees the board of aldermen shall have the power by ordinance to fix the compensation of the officers and employees of the city    changes in compensation of elected city officers the board of aldermen shall not change the salary of any city officer during the time for which he was elected    authority to prescribe and enforce rules for transacting business the board of aldermen may prescribe and enforce such rules as it may find necessary for the expeditious transaction of its business    power to compel attendance of witnesses and production of recordsexecution of process feesoaths the board of aldermen shall have the power to compel the attendance of witnesses and the production of papers and records relating to any subject under consideration in which the interest of the city is involved and shall have the power to call on the city marshal or any policeman of the city or the sheriff of this county to execute such process the officer making such service shall be allowed to receive therefor such fees as are allowed by law in the circuit court for similar services to be paid by the city the mayor or acting president of the board of aldermen shall have the power to administer oaths to such witnesses    exempting persons from taxes prohibited the board of aldermen shall have no power to relieve any person from the payment of any tax or exempt any person from any assessment or other burden imposed upon him by law    semiannual financial statement the board of aldermen shall semiannually each year at times to be set by the board of aldermen make out and spread upon their records a full and detailed account and statement of the receipts and expenditures and indebtedness of the city for the half year ending with the last day of the month immediately preceding the date of such report which account and statement shall be published in some newspaper in the city    meetingstime regular meetings of the board of aldermen shall be held at sixthirty pm on the first and third tuesdays of each and every month and adjourned meetings whenever the mayor and board of aldermen shall deem the same necessary   71712   special meetings the mayor or any two members of the board of aldermen may call a special meeting of the board of aldermen at any time by causing the city marshal or other police officer to serve a notice upon members of the board of aldermen and mayor of the time fixed for such special meeting such notice shall be signed by those calling such special meeting and shall be served on the remaining members by delivering a copy of such notice to each of the parties to be served or by leaving a copy of such notice at his usual place of residence or business with some member of his family above the age of fifteen 15 years or with his clerk agent or representative in business    failure to attend meetings finesloss of office a any aldermen failing to attend any regular meeting of the board of aldermen or after being duly notified shall neglect or refuse to attend an adjourned or special meeting without having a reasonable excuse to be accepted by the board may be fined not less than one dollar $100 nor more than five dollars $500 b whenever any member of the board of aldermen shall absent himself from two or more successive meetings of the board of aldermen without having a reasonable excuse for his absence the board by a vote of twothirds of the members elected thereto may expel such member and declare his office vacant    mayor to presidevoting the mayor shall have a seat in and preside over the board of aldermen but shall not vote on any question except in the case of a tie nor shall he preside or vote in cases when he is an interested party    election of board president at the first meeting of the board of aldermen the board shall elect a president of the board    election of acting president when mayor is absent in the absence of the mayor the president of the board of aldermen shall preside over the board in the absence of the mayor or president of the board of aldermen the board shall elect one of their own number to occupy the place temporarily who shall be styled acting president of the board of aldermen    journal of proceedings to be maintained the board of aldermen shall cause to be kept a journal of its proceedings    quorum requirements adjournmentsummoning absent members a majority of the members of the board of aldermen shall constitute a quorum to do business  but a smaller number may adjourn from time to time and may send a special messenger for any absent member    mayor to call meetings to order the mayor shall take the chair at the hour to which the board of aldermen may have previously adjourned and on appearance of a quorum shall call the board members to order and cause the proceedings of the previous meeting to be read    order of business a the mayor or his designate shall establish an agenda or order of business for each meeting b any business may be called up out of order by consent of a majority of the board members present  1998 prior code  244   mayor to preserve order and decide questions it shall be the duty of the mayor to preserve order and decorum at all meetings of the board of aldermen and to decide all questions of order subject to an appeal to the board    members to vote when question is put when a question is put by the mayor each member of the board of aldermen present if not personally interested shall vote unless the board for special reasons shall excuse him    procedure when ayes and nays demanded if the ayes and nays are demanded by two members of the board of aldermen the names of the board members shall be called alphabetically their votes recorded in the journal the absentees voted and the result announced by the presiding officers of the board    interested members not to vote legal effect no member of the board of aldermen shall be permitted to vote for or against any ordinance appropriating money or for the allowance of any account or claim or for the award or approval of any contract in which such member is directly or indirectly interested any ordinance resolution or motion having passed by the vote of such interested member shall be deemed illegal and of no effect    when motion to be written every motion made at any meeting of the board of aldermen shall be reduced to writing if the presiding officer of the board or any board member shall require it    motion to be seconded before debate no motion made at any meeting of the board of aldermen shall be debated unless it is seconded    procedure when motion is seconded when a motion is made and seconded at any meeting of the board of aldermen it shall be stated by the presiding officer of the board or if in writing it shall be read aloud by the city clerk before debate shall be in order on the same    motions which can be made when question is put when a question is before the board of aldermen for consideration no motion shall be in order except a motion for an amendment for postponement for commitment to lie on the table or for adjournment    when motion may be withdrawn any motion made at a board meeting may be withdrawn by the mover at any time before an amendment is offered to it or a decision is made thereto  and any motion may be withdrawn by the mover at any time before final decision if the unanimous consent of the whole board is obtained therefor    motion to adjourn a motion to adjourn shall always be in order at a board meeting unless a board member is speaking and shall be decided without debate    reconsideration of motions whenever a motion has been put and decided in the affirmative or negative it shall be in order for any board member who voted on the side which prevailed to move for a reconsideration thereof at the same meeting or at the next meeting thereafter but not afterwards after a motion has once been reconsidered it shall not be reconsidered again for six months thereafter    amendments to an amendment an amendment to an amendment may be permitted at a board meeting but no further amendments shall be allowed    speaking permitted only when motion is before board no member of the board of aldermen shall speak at a board meeting unless there is a motion before the board    recognition by chair when two or more persons at a board meeting rise to speak or deliver any matter to the board the presiding officer of the board shall name the one who shall proceed    members to address chair when a member of the board of aldermen rises to speak at a board meeting he shall respectfully address the presiding officer    members to be seated when another is speaking no member of the board of aldermen shall leave his seat during a board meeting while another member is speaking    speaking on same subject restricted no member of the board of aldermen shall speak more than once on the same subject at a board meeting until every member choosing to speak shall have spoken    members to abstain from personalities in debate every member of the board of aldermen shall abstain from personalities in debate during any board meeting    referring matters to committees whenever it shall be necessary to refer any matter to a committee the presiding officer of the board shall upon motion of any member appoint such committee    disturbing members may be fined no member of the board of aldermen shall disturb any board meeting by walking across the floor carrying on private discourse or doing anything which might annoy the board or any member thereof any violator of this section may be fined at the discretion of the presiding officer    ordinancesstyleformsynopsisreadingsmotion for passage a the style of the ordinances of the city shall be be it ordained by the mayor and board of aldermen of the city of perryville missouri as follows b all ordinances shall be introduced to the board of aldermen in printed or electronic written form c upon request by any member of the board of aldermen the city clerk shall prepare copies of all proposed ordinances for distribution to all members of the board on tuesday before the meeting at which the ordinance is to be introduced upon request by any member of the board of aldermen the city administrator shall prepare a synopsis of each ordinance to be introduced and attach said synopsis to the copies distributed to the board d ordinances shall be read two times ordinances shall be read in full or by title only where copies are available to the board of aldermen and those in attendance on the first reading and may not be amended the ordinances shall be read by title only on second reading e except as provided in subsection f of this section any ordinance which shall have had its first reading shall be taken up by the board of aldermen at its next session and shall be read the second time and thereupon shall be open for debate and amendment on the close of debate the presiding officer shall entertain a motion to place such ordinance on final passage f first and second readings of an ordinance may occur at a single meeting of the board of aldermen only if 1 the ordinance is designated in the body of the bill as an emergency ordinance for the immediate preservation of public peace property health safety morals or other good cause or 2 the ordinance is designated in the body of the bill as a matter related to zoning as found in title 17 of this code which has previously been reviewed and approved by the planning and zoning commission g the motion for final passage shall not be debatable and shall take precedence over all other motions except one for adjournment upon being seconded the presiding officer shall immediately put the motion to the board of aldermen if the motion is adopted no further debate or amendment shall be allowed and the clerk shall immediately call the roll for its final passage if such motion is not adopted the ordinance shall still be open for debate and amendment until such time as a motion for final passage is adopted h all ordinances passed by the board of aldermen as set forth in this section shall take effect immediately upon their passage unless in the body of the bill a different effective date is set forth  1998  prior code  25  10714   ordinancespassageveto power of mayoroverriding veto a no ordinance shall be passed except by bill and except where otherwise provided in this section no bill shall become an ordinance unless on its final passage a majority of the members elected to the board of aldermen shall vote for it and the ayes and nays be entered on the journal  all bills shall be read two times before their passage b except as otherwise provided in this section no bill shall become an ordinance until it has been signed by the mayor or person exercising the duties of the mayors office c the mayor shall have the power to sign or veto any ordinance passed by the board of aldermen  provided however that if the mayor neglects or refuses to sign any ordinance and returns same without his objections in writing at the next regular meeting of the board of aldermen the same shall become law without his signature d every bill duly passed by the board of aldermen and presented to the mayor and by him approved shall become an ordinance and every bill presented as aforesaid but returned with the mayors objections thereto shall stand reconsidered the board of aldermen shall cause the objections of the mayor to be entered at large upon the journal and proceed at its convenience to consider the question pending which shall be in this form shall the bill pass the objections of the mayor thereto notwithstanding the vote on this question shall be taken by ayes and nays and the names entered upon the journal if twothirds of all the memberselect shall vote in the affirmative the city clerk shall certify the fact on the roll and the bill thus certified shall be deposited with the proper officer and shall become an ordinance in the same manner and with like effect as if it had received the approval of the mayor  1998  prior code  26   ordinancesrevivification and reenactment no ordinance shall be revived or reenacted by mere reference to the title thereof but the same shall be set forth at length as if it were an original ordinance    violation of rules if any member of the board of aldermen violates any rule of the board the presiding officer shall and any board member may call him to order whereupon the offending member shall take his seat or upon leave may be allowed to explain    authoritative sources when city ordinance state statute or case law is not controlling concerning the interpretation of ordinances roberts rules of order as printed by william morrow and company inc of new york new york 1979 edition shall be considered the authoritative source and controlling  city officers generally officers electedterms a the mayor board of aldermen city collector and municipal judge shall be elected by the qualified voters of the city and shall hold office for a term of two years and until their successors are elected and qualified b the chief of police shall be elected by the qualified voters of the city and shall hold office for a term of four years and until his successor is elected and qualified c no person shall be an alderman unless he or she is at least twentyone 21 years of age a citizen of the united states an inhabitant and resident of the city for one year next preceding his or her election and a resident at least at the time he or she files and during the time he or she serves of the ward from which he or she is elected  2000 prior code  276   qualifications a all officers elected or appointed to offices under the city government shall be qualified voters under the laws and constitution of this state and the ordinances of the city and shall be residents of the city  provided however that this section shall not apply to appointed police officers the city attorney and other employees having only ministerial duties b no person shall be elected or appointed to any office under the city government who shall at the time be in arrears for any unpaid city taxes or forfeiture or defalcation in office    oath of office every officer of the city his assistants and every alderman before entering upon the duties of his office shall take and subscribe to an oath or affirmation before some court of record in the county or the city clerk that he possesses all the qualifications prescribed for his office by law  that he will support the constitution of the united states and of the state of missouri the provisions of all laws of this state affecting cities of the fourth class and the ordinances of the city  and that he will faithfully demean himself while in office  which official oath or affirmation shall be filed with the city clerk    bond requirements a all city officers who are required to give bond by this code shall be covered by a surety bond purchased by the city with the terms and conditions of the surety bond to be determined and negotiated by the city with the bonding company or entity contracting with the city the surety bond shall be conditioned upon the faithful performance of the duties of the city officers and shall insure that the city offiover all monies belonging to the city as provided by law that may come into their hands and that they will turn over to their successors in office or to such other proper officer of the city all books papers and personal property of whatsoever nature in their custody belonging to the city in the event of any breach of condition of any such bond suit may be instituted thereon by the city or by any person in the name of the city to recover any monies assets books papers or personal property of whatsoever nature belonging to the city b city officers shall be bonded in the following exercising the duties of the mayor shall cause a special meeting of the board of aldermen to convene where a successor to the vacant office shall be selected the successor shall serve until the next regular municipal election b if any vacancy occurs in any office of the city not elective the mayor shall appoint a suitable person to discharge the duties of such office until the first regular meeting of the board of aldermen thereafter at which time such vacancy shall be permanently filled  1998  prior code  281   books accounts and reports to conform with fiscal year all books accounts official any employee who feels that he or she is being subjected to harassment as defined in this code by an elected official shall immediately submit his or her complaint in writing to the personnel clerk that complaint shall be immediately given to the city attorney who shall prepare a report to the board of aldermen concerning said complaint and that complaint shall be presented to the board of aldermen in closed session in making such report the city attorney shall take reasonable steps to maintain the confidentiality of the complaining employee if possible if the mayor determines that immediate action under necessary the mayor may proceed with suspension of the elected official the city shall conduct such investigation as may be necessary and shall take such steps as are necessary to comply with applicable state and federal laws regarding harassment and discrimination including the laws regarding retaliation if the complaint is substantiated by the investigation then the public process set forth in be initiated if the elected official chooses to resign rather than go removal process outlined in the resignation shall be accepted and the findings of the investigation shall be made public  12313   suspension or removal of elective officers a the mayor is empowered to suspend from office any elective officer of the city for any of the following causes 1 a wilful violation of any of his official obligations  2 any culpable official negligence or dereliction of duty  3 any conduct inconsistent with his official character and duty  or 4 for official incompetency b any suspension under subsection a of this section shall be effected by an order filed by the mayor in the office of the city clerk accompanied by a statement of the charges upon which the same is founded a copy of which shall be forthwith made by the clerk and delivered to the city marshal who shall forthwith deliver the same to the elective officer suspended  and if any elective city officer shall during suspension from office attempt to perform any official duty he shall be punished as provided in c the mayor shall report any suspension under this section and lay the charge before the board of aldermen if in session at the time and if not at its next regular session thereafter the board of aldermen shall investigate the same without unnecessary delay d whenever any elective city officer shall be suspended as aforesaid or shall be charged by the mayor any member of the board of aldermen or any other city officer or by affidavit of any reputable citizen of the city filed with the city clerk with a wilful violation of any of his official obligations or any culpable official negligence or dereliction of duty or with any conduct inconsistent with his official character and duty or with official incompetency the board of aldermen shall appoint a committee to investigate the same such committee if it shall deem the charge well founded shall frame and report to the board of aldermen charges and specifications against such officer and the board of aldermen shall appoint a day for the hearing thereof and cause a copy of such charges and specifications with a notice of the time and place set for the hearing to be delivered to such officer at least five days before the day set for the hearing e at the time set for the hearing under this section the board of aldermen shall meet and proceed according to such rules as it may adopt to hear the evidence against and in favor of the accused and may adjourn from time to time if necessary until all the evidence is heard f the mayor or person acting as such shall preside at all hearings under this section but in cases where the charges are against the mayor the president of the board of aldermen shall preside and in case the charges are against the person acting as mayor and such person is also the president of the board of aldermen the remaining members of the board of aldermen shall choose one of their number to preside g upon any hearing under this section the accused shall be entitled to be heard by himself and his counsel in his defense and the city attorney or person acting as such shall attend such hearing and prosecute on behalf of the city h subpoenas for witnesses to testify at any hearing under this section may be issued by the mayor or person acting as such or in case the charges shall be against the mayor by the president of the board of aldermen and shall be served and returned by any proper officer of the city such officer and witnesses shall be entitled to the same fees as would be allowed for like services in the police judges court i the mayor or person acting as such or in case the charges are against the mayor the president of the board of aldermen shall have power to administer oaths to witnesses in all proceedings before the board of aldermen under this section j as soon as all of the evidence has been taken at any hearing under this section and the case submitted the board of aldermen shall vote by yeas and nays upon each charge and specification separately the question upon each charge shall be is the accused guilty if the board of aldermen by a majority vote of all the members elected find the accused guilty of any of the charges and such finding is approved by the mayor the accused shall by resolution be removed from office if the board of aldermen shall by a twothirds vote of all its members find the accused guilty he shall be removed from office by resolution independent of the mayors approval and the office thereupon shall be declared vacant k the proceedings of the board of aldermen under this section shall be entered at large upon the journal of the proceedings of the board of aldermen    removal of appointive officers the mayor may with the consent of a majority of all the members elected to the board of aldermen remove from office any appointive officer of the city at will and any such appointive officer may be so removed by a twothirds vote of all the members of the board of aldermen independently of the mayors approval or recommendation in no case shall it be necessary to present charges and specifications or assign any reason for the removal of any appointive officer of the city    defense of city officers the board of aldermen shall purchase such insurance as the board of aldermen in its absolute discretion deems prudent and necessary to cover any liability claims made or brought against any city officers as a result of the city officers performing their duties or responsibilities on behalf of the city to the extent that the actions of any city officer in the performance of the city officers duties or responsibilities to the city are not covered by a policy of liability insurance then the city shall employ and pay for the legal representation of any city officer in the defense of the city officers actions to carry out the city officers duties and responsibilities on behalf of the city if the board of aldermen deems that any payment judgment amount or settlement amount against any city officer is the result of the performance of the city officers duties and responsibilities to the city and if the actions of the city officer are not covered by a policy of liability insurance then the board of aldermen may allocate such sums as are necessary to pay such payment judgment amount or settlement amount against any city officer city officers shall include but not be limited to the mayor members of the board of aldermen the city administrator the city attorney the city clerk the city treasurer the municipal judge the building official the city engineer and the citys fire and police officers  51711   41916 mayor office established there is established the office of mayor    qualifications a no person shall be mayor unless he is at least twentyfive 25 years of age a citizen of the united states a resident of the city at the time of and for at least one year next preceding his election and a qualified voter under the laws and constitution of this state and the ordinances of the city b no person shall be mayor who shall at the time of his election be in arrears for any unpaid city taxes or forfeiture or defalcation in office c no person shall be mayor who has been found guilty of or pled guilty to a felony or misdemeanor under the federal laws of the united states or to a felony under the laws of this state or an offense committed in another state that would be considered a felony in this state d no person shall be mayor who has not filed a candidates affidavit of tax payments and bonding requirements with the missouri department of revenue form 5120 as required by rsmo  2000 prior code  294  12115   compensation the mayor shall receive as compensation the aldermen    communications to board the mayor shall from time to time communicate to the board of aldermen such measures as may in his opinion tend to the improvement of the finances the police health security ornament comfort and general prosperity of the city    supervision of officers and city affairs the mayor shall exercise a general supervision over all the officers and affairs of the city    handling of violations by officers the mayor shall cause all subordinate city officers to be dealt with promptly for any neglect or violation of duty    enforcement of ordinances and laws the mayor shall be active and vigilant in enforcing all state laws and city ordinances for the government of the city    authority to summon aid the mayor is authorized to call on every inhabitant of the city of the city    attendance of board meetings journal of proceedings the city clerk shall attend all meetings of the board of aldermen and keep a correct journal of its proceedings    custodian of certain property a the city clerk shall have the custody of and safely keep the seal of the city the public records the original rolls of ordinances and resolutions of the board of aldermen and such other records documents and papers of public nature as may be delivered into his custody b the city clerk shall have the custody of all public account books accounts vouchers documents bonds and coupons paid or redeemed all papers relating to accounts and contracts of the city and its revenue debt and fiscal affairs not required by law or ordinance to be placed in some other office or kept by some other person    labeling recording and filing duties the city clerk shall neatly label record and file for safekeeping the original roll of all ordinances and resolutions of the board of aldermen issue and shall keep a record of the same    affixing city seal to documents a the city clerk shall affix the seal of the city to all public instruments and documents and official acts of the mayor which by law or ordinance are required to be so attested and countersign the same b the city clerk shall affix the seal of the city to and certify any record document copies of papers or ordinances that may be required for evidence in any court of this state or of the united states by any individual or that may be required for the use of any officer in the city    recording of revenue the city clerk shall keep a complete record of all branches of the city revenue opening an account with every appropriation or fund which by law or ordinance is made a separate fund crediting the same with all moneys paid into the city treasury on account thereof and charging said appropriation or fund with all warrants drawn thereon    recording of liabilities the city clerk shall keep a record of all obligations of the city specifying the date of issuance for what purpose issued the rate of interest the time when principal and interest become due the amount of principal to whom payable and the registered number of each bond and coupon    drawing of warrants a in all cases of accounts audited and allowed against the city and for the payment of which the mayor and board of aldermen by ordinance shall have made the necessary appropriation it shall be the duty of the city clerk to draw a warrant on the city treasury for the amount due b the city clerk shall express in the body of every warrant drawn upon the treasurer the particular fund out of which the same is to be paid    register of warrants to be maintained the city clerk shall keep a register of all warrants drawn upon the city treasurer specifying the number date to whom payable on what fund or appropriation drawn and the amount of each warrant    accounting of officers handling money the city clerk shall keep in a set of books provided for that purpose accurate accounts between the city and all city officers charged with the collection custody or disbursement of public moneys and shall enter thereupon all receipts and payments from what source derived and on what account paid    bonding of utility collection clerks the utility collection clerks shall be covered by a surety bond supplied by the city in the amount and manner as provided in this code  5311   licensespreparation issuance and record the city clerk shall prepare blank licenses for all purposes for which licenses are required to be issued treasurer shall not disburse any city funds except upon warrants properly drawn and which are signed by the mayor and attested by the city clerk    warrants bonds and obligations the city treasurer shall receive and safely keep all warrants bonds and obligations of the city entrusted to his care and shall dispose of the same only upon proper authority from the board of aldermen or as provided by this code    accounts to be maintained the city treasurer shall keep in a set of books provided for that purpose a full and accurate account of all moneys received and disbursed by him on behalf of the city specifying the date of receipt or disbursement from whom received to whom disbursed and on what account received and disbursed    money paid into treasury disposition the city treasurer shall issue duplicate receipts for all sums of money which may be paid into the city treasury specifying in the receipts the date of payment and upon what account paid one of these receipts shall be given to the person making the payment and the other he shall file with the city clerk who thereupon shall credit the person named in the receipt with the amount of his payment and charge the treasurer with the same    warrants to be paid only when presented by proper person the city treasurer shall not pay any warrant drawn on him unless such warrant is presented by the person in whose favor the same is drawn or by his assignee executor or administrator    register of warrants to be maintained the city treasurer shall keep a register of all warrants paid into the treasury describing such warrants by their date number name of payee and amount specifying the time of receipt thereof from whom received and on what account    manner of canceling debts the city treasurer shall cancel all bonds coupons warrants and other evidences of debt against the city whenever paid by him by writing or stamping across the face thereof the words paid by the city treasurer with the date of payment written or stamped thereon    furnishing fiscal information to mayor and board the city treasurer shall give information in writing to the mayor and board of aldermen whenever required upon any subject relating to his office or the fiscal affairs of the city    financial statements the city treasurer shall prepare a financial statement for the board of aldermen and the various board and department heads of the city as requested by them    preparation of annual budget the city treasurer shall assist in the preparation of the annual budget of the city    maintenance of books and records the city treasurer shall assist the city clerk in maintaining the financial books and records of the city    monthly reports to board the city treasurer shall make a monthly report to the board of aldermen not later than the second regular meeting which report shall show the balance in the city treasury at the beginning of the month the amount received during the month and credited to the various funds the amount disbursed during the month and the balance remaining to the credit of each fund and constituting the general balance in the treasury at the close of business on the day when such statement is made as aforesaid    annual report to board the city treasurer shall report to the board of aldermen at its first regular meeting held in april of each year the amount of receipts and disbursements of the city treasury during the preceding year the balance remaining to the credit of each fund and constituting the general balance in the treasury on the first day of april the amount of bonds maturing in the succeeding year if any for the redemption of which provision must be made and the amount of money required to pay interest falling due on the indebtedness of the city during the next fiscal year    final settlement at the first regular meeting of the board of aldermen held in april of each year the city treasurer shall if demanded by the board of aldermen present the mayor and board of aldermen for final settlement a general statement of his accounts for the past fiscal year such statement shall show the amount of all receipts into the city treasury and of all payments made by him during such term the condition of the treasury on the first day of april the balance remaining on that day to the credit of each fund and such settlement when made and approved by the mayor and board of aldermen shall be entered of record in the office of the city clerk    additional duties in addition to the duties prescribed in this chapter the city treasurer shall perform all other duties as may be required of him by state law    misuse of funds the city treasurer is expressly prohibited from using either directly or indirectly for his own benefit or that of any other person any money warrant or other obligation of the city in his custody    violationspenalties if the city treasurer wilfully neglects or refuses to perform any of the duties enjoined upon him by ordinance or by resolution of the mayor and board of aldermen or if he is guilty of any oppression or extortion in the discharge of his official duties or if by color of his office he knowingly does any act not authorized by ordinance he shall be punished as provided in  city attorney office established there is established the office of city attorney    qualifications no person shall be appointed city attorney who is not a licensed attorney under the laws of the state    compensation the city attorney shall receive compensation as established by by the annual budget ordinance or by other ordinance officially passed and approved by the board of aldermen    attendance of board meetings the city attorney shall attend all meetings of the board of aldermen    drawing up ordinances the city attorney shall draw up any ordinance requested by any member of the board of aldermen    preparation of documents and notices in all proceedings connected with the affairs of the city the city attorney shall prepare all legal documents connected therewith and see that all documents and notices are properly made out served and properly returned    adviser of commissions and boards the city attorney shall be the legal adviser of the airport commission park board planning and zoning board and such other boards as may be appointed by the mayor    advising board committees and officers the city attorney shall advise the board of aldermen or its committees or any city officer on such legal questions as may arise in relation to the affairs of the city    furnishing written opinions the city attorney shall furnish written opinions on legal questions whenever the same shall be required by the board of aldermen    preparation of charges and complaints against violatorsprosecutionaffidavits the city attorney shall prepare all charges and complaints against parties charged with a violation of the city ordinances shall prosecute the same on behalf of the city and shall make all affidavits on behalf of the city necessary in procuring changes of venue or taking appeals    prosecution and defense of suits it shall be the duty of the city attorney to prosecute or defend all suits in any court in which the city may be a party and all suits in which any officer of the city may be a party arising out of said officers legal acts    additional duties in addition to the duties prescribed in this chapter the city attorney shall perform any and all other duties required of him by the laws of this state    employment of counsel when no person is appointed to office in case no city attorney is appointed the mayor or board of aldermen may by resolution employ an attorney or attorneys to perform any legal services required by the city and pay him or them a reasonable fee or compensation therefor    employment of additional counsel in case a city attorney has been appointed the mayor and board of aldermen may if they deem it necessary employ additional counsel and pay them reasonable compensation for any legal services demanded by the city    appointment of substitute during temporary disability in case of sickness absence from the city or other temporary inability of the city attorney to discharge the duties of his office he may with the approbation of the mayor and at his own expense appoint some competent attorney to act in his stead during such sickness absence from the city or other temporary inability if such appointment is not made as aforesaid then it shall be the duty of the police judge to appoint some competent attorney to represent the city in all cases before his court pending such temporary inability of the city attorney to perform the duties of his office and the person so appointed shall possess the same powers and receive the same fees as the regular city attorney would if he were present  city engineer office established there is established the office of city engineer    qualifications the city engineer shall have a knowledge of surveying and civil engineering    compensation the city engineer shall receive compensation as established by by the annual budget ordinance or by other ordinance officially passed and approved by the board of aldermen    general duties the city engineer shall perform such duties as the board of aldermen shall require from time to time  city administrator office created the office of city administrator is created    appointment the city administrator shall be appointed by the mayor with approval of a majority of elected members of the board of aldermen for an indefinite term he shall be at least twentyone 21 years of age and shall be chosen solely on the basis of his executive and administrative qualifications the choice of the city administrator shall not be limited by residence qualifications  however he shall reside within the city limits while in office and shall devote his full time to the performance of the duties of his office    city administrator serves at the pleasure of the mayor and board of aldermen the city administrator serves at the pleasure of the mayor and board of aldermen and may be removed at any time as set forth in this code  91509   oath of office before entering upon the duties of his office the city administrator shall take and subscribe to an oath or affirmation before the city clerk or someone authorized to administer oaths that he possesses all the qualifications prescribed for his office by law  that he will support the constitution of the united states and the state of missouri  the provisions of all laws of the state of missouri and the ordinances of the city  and that he will faithfully demean himself while in office    bond the city administrator shall be covered by a surety bond supplied by the city in the amount and manner as provided in this code   5311   compensation the compensation of the city administrator shall be established in accordance with the annual budget ordinance or ordinance approving the annual pay plan    removal from office the city administrator shall serve at the pleasure of the appointing authority as set forth in this code the mayor with consent of a majority of all members of the board of aldermen may remove the city administrator from office at will and such city administrator may also be removed by a threefourths vote of all members elected to the board of aldermen independently of the mayors approval or recommendations the city administrator shall request a public hearing within five days of removal if requested the mayor and board of aldermen shall grant the city administrator a public hearing within thirty 30 days following notice of removal during the interim the city administrator shall be suspended from duty but shall continue his salary and if after a hearing removal becomes final the city administrator shall only be entitled to compensation if it is required in the existing employment agreement with the city administrator   91509   1 121818   evaluations it is the policy of the
