shall be deemed committed on each day during which the violation occurs or continues  2003   summary abatement of nuisances a procedure 1 complaint all complaints alleging the existence of a nuisance shall be made to the director any resident including any city elected official officer or employee may initiate a complaint 2 inspection the director shall promptly inspect the premises or cause them to be inspected and shall make a written report of the findings of the inspection whenever practical photographs of the premises shall be attached to the written report the director shall keep all such written reports on file for at least three years 3 abatement upon the discovery of a public nuisance the inspecting officer may order the owner or other person creating keeping maintaining or permitting the same to abate it 4 immediate dangerexistence should the inspecting officer find that a public nuisance exists and that the public health welfare or safety may be in immediate danger then summary abatement procedures shall be implemented and the inspecting official or department may cause the nuisance to be removed or abated 5 summary abatementcost summary abatement costs shall be certified by the city clerk and assigned to the annual real estate tax bill for the property 6 if the public nuisance involves a building that appears structurally unsafe the city shall follow those procedures promulgated in of this chapter b summary abatementnotice when summary abatement is authorized notice to the owner agent or occupant of the property is not required following summary abatement the director shall cause to be posted on the property liable for the abatement a notice describing the action taken to abate the nuisance  part 1998 prior code  20443  11017   abatement of nuisances in other cases a procedure upon the discovery of a public nuisance that does not pose an immediate danger to the public health welfare or safety the director shall cause a written report of the property on which the nuisance exists to be prepared photographs and findings shall be included in the report if the director declares the existence of a public nuisance but the nature thereof is not such as to require the summary abatement of such nuisance then the director may order the abatement of the nuisance by notice in compliance with b abatement by owner within ten days after the posting or personal service or mailing of a notice to abate a nuisance the owner or individual in possession of the affected property shall remove and abate such nuisance or show that the actions for abating the nuisance have commenced such showing shall be made by filing a written statement or other proof of such actions with the director c abatement by city if after a hearing in compliance with this chapter it is found that the nuisance or dangerous condition exists the director shall have the authority to enter upon the property and abate the public nuisance found thereon in abating such nuisance the director may go to whatever extent may be necessary to complete the abatement of the public nuisance if it is practicable to salvage any material derived in the aforesaid abatement the director may sell the salvaged material at private or public sale and shall keep an accounting of the proceeds thereof d proceeds from sale of private property the proceeds if any obtained from the sale of any material salvaged as a result of an abatement of a public nuisance by the director shall be deposited to the general fund of the city and deficit between the amount so received and the cost of the abatement shall be filed with the city clerk the city clerk shall certify the costs and assess costs to the annual real estate tax bill for the property should the proceeds of the sale of the salvaged material exceed the cost of the abatement the surplus if any shall be paid to the owner of the property from which the public nuisance was abated when a proper claim to the excess if established e authorized action in abating a public nuisance the director may call upon any of the city departments or divisions for whatever assistance shall be deemed necessary or may by private contract cause the abatement of the public nuisance f statement of costs the director shall after completing the removal and abatement file a statement of costs with the city clerk the city clerk shall certify costs and assign costs to the annual real estate tax bill for the property g prior recovery the city may seek to recover the cost of demolition prior to the occurrence of demolition upon issuance of an order by the director whereby the building or structure is ordered to be demolished secured or repaired then the building inspector may solicit no less than two independent bids for such demolition work the amount of the lowest bid including offset for salvage value if any plus reasonable anticipated costs of collection including attorneys fees shall be certified to the city clerk who shall cause a special tax bill to be issued against the property owner to be prepared and collected by the city clerk the city clerk shall discharge the special tax bill upon documentation by the property owner of the completion of the ordered repair or demolition work upon determination by the city clerk that a public benefit is secured prior to payment of the special tax bill the city clerk may discharge the special tax bill upon the transfer of the property the payment of the special tax bill shall be held in an interestbearing account upon full payment of the special tax bill the director shall within one hundred twenty 120 days thereafter cause the ordered work to be completed and certify the actual cost thereof including the cost of tax bill collection and attorneys fees to the city clerk who shall if the actual cost differs from the paid amount by greater than two percent of the paid amount refund the excess payment if any to the payor or if the actual amount is greater cause a special tax bill or assessment for the difference against the property to be prepared and collected by the city clerk if the director shall not within one hundred twenty 120 days after full payment cause the ordered work to be completed then the full amount of the payment plus interest shall be repaid to the payor at the request of the taxpayer the tax bill for the difference may be paid in installments over a period of not more than ten years the tax bill for the difference from the date of its issuance shall be deemed a personal debt against the property owner and shall also be a lien on the property until paid  part 1998 prior code  2044449   41916   11017   notice a service of notice the director shall determine all individuals firms or corporations who from the records in against the property b objection if the property owner or his representative objects to determination of cost he may appeal same to the city administrator by delivering a written notice of appeal to the city administrator within twenty 20 days of the mailing of the notice thereof if no appeal is taken or perfected the initial determination of costs shall be final c absence of appeal if no appeal shall be canceled if after the hearing it is determined that the proposed assessment or any part of it is proper and authorized the city administrator shall so certify to the city clerk who shall enter a lien in such amount as determined appropriate by the city administrator e finality of administrators decision if the judgment of the city administrator is not appealed to the circuit court clearly indicates that a different meaning is intended city means the city of perryville missouri dbas means decibels as shown in a reading made on the dba scale decibel db means a unit for measuring the volume of a sound equal to twenty 20 times the logarithm to the base ten of the ratio of the pressure of the sound measured to the reference pressure which is twenty 20 micropascals twenty 20 micronewtons per square meter sound level meter means an instrument used for measurement of the intensity of sound and accurately calibrated in decibels readings shall be made on a dba scale sound pressure means the average rate at which sound energy is transmitted unit area in a specified direction vehicular pertains to motor vehicles required to be registered by the division of motor vehicles for the state  part 1998 prior code  2070  11017   restrictions a the making creation or permitting of any unreasonably loud disturbing or unnecessary noise in the city is prohibited b the making creating or permitting of any noise of such character intensity or duration as to be detrimental to the life health or welfare of any individual or which either steadily or intermittently annoys disturbs injures or endangers the comfort repose peace or safety or any individual is prohibited c the following standards shall apply 1 residential zones no person shall cause suffer allow or permit sound from any source which when measured at the point of annoyance is in excess of the following a seven am to ten pm i continuous airborne sound which has a sound level of seventyfive 75 dbas  ii impulsive sound in air which has an impulsive sound level of eightyfive 85 dbas b ten pm to seven am i continuous airborne sound which has a sound level of sixtyfive 65 dbas  ii impulsive sound in air which has an impulsive sound level of eighty 80 dbas 2 industrial and commercial zones no person shall cause suffer allow or permit sound from any source which when measured at the point of annoyance is in excess of the following a seven am to ten pm i continuous airborne sound of eightyfive 85 dbas  ii impulsive sound in air with an impulsive sound level of ninetyfive 95 dbas b ten pm to seven am i continuous airborne sound which has a sound level of seventyfive 75 dbas  ii impulsive sound in air which has an impulsive sound level of eightyfive 85 dbas 3 waiver of noise standards the board of aldermen may in its absolute discretion waive the noise standards for short periods of time to facilitate community oriented events the event shall only be located in a city park or in an area zoned commercial or industrial the board of aldermen shall set specific times for any waivers the board of aldermen may require such noise dampening structures and engineering as it deems fit  part 1998 prior code  2071  111913   declared unnecessary noises enumerated the following acts among others are declared to be loud or disturbing or unnecessary noises in violation of this division even if the iv when otherwise necessary as a danger signal 2 wherever the sounding of any horn or signal device is permitted or required such sound shall not be unreasonably loud or harsh and shall not be for unreasonable duration of time b animals and birds the keeping of any animal or bird which by causing frequent or longcontinued noise disturbs the comfort and repose of any person in the vicinity c xiii ice pipes or chillers in determining whether an object is drug paraphernalia a court or other authority should consider in addition to all other logically relevant factors the following a statements by an owner or by anyone in control of the object concerning its use  b prior convictions if any of an owner or of anyone in control of the object under any state or federal law relating to any controlled substance or imitation controlled substance  c the proximity of the object in time and space to a direct violation of this section  d the proximity of the object to controlled substances or imitation controlled substances  e the existence of any residue of controlled substances or imitation controlled substances on the object  f direct or circumstantial evidence of the intent of an owner or of anyone in control of the object to deliver it to persons who he knows or should reasonably know intend to use the object to facilitate a violation of revised statutes of missouri  the innocence of an owner or of anyone in control of the object as to a direct violation of revised statutes of missouri shall not prevent a finding that the object is intended for use or designed for use as drug paraphernalia  g instructions oral or written provided with the object concerning its use  h descriptive materials accompanying the object which explain or depict its use  i national or local advertising concerning its use  j the manner in which the object is displayed for sale  k whether the owner or anyone in control of the object is a legitimate supplier of like or related items to the community such as a licensed distributor or dealer of tobacco products  l direct or circumstantial evidence of the ratio of sales of the object to the total sales of the business emergency vehicle pursuant to state law or when directed to do so by a law enforcement officer c 1 all vehicles in an organized funeral procession shall follow the preceding vehicle in the procession as closely as is practical and safe under the conditions 2 no person shall operate any vehicle as part of an organized funeral procession without the flashing emergency lights of such vehicle being lighted 3 toll free passage shall be given on all toll bridges tunnels and other toll highways to all vehicles in an organized funeral procession d any person who is not an operator of a vehicle in an organized funeral procession shall not 1 drive between the vehicles comprising an organized funeral procession while such vehicles are in motion and have the flashing emergency lights lighted pursuant to state law except when required to do so by a law enforcement officer or when such person is operating an emergency vehicle giving an audible or visual signal  2 join a funeral procession for the purpose of securing the rightofway granted pursuant to state law  3 attempt to pass any vehicle in an organized funeral procession except where a passing lane has been specifically provided e when an organized funeral procession is proceeding red signal light as permitted herein a vehicle not in the organized funeral procession shall not enter the intersection unless such vehicle may do so without crossing the path of the funeral procession f any person violating the provisions of this section is guilty of an infraction which shall be punishable by a fine not to exceed one hundred dollars $10000 g no ordinance regulation or any other provision of law shall prohibit the use of a motorcycle utilizing flashing amber lights to escort an organized funeral procession on the highway  2000 methamphetamine precursor drugs   general policy the board of aldermen of the city has found the manufacture transportation possession and sale of methamphetamine to be inherently dangerous and that the chemical precursors of methamphetamine and the byproducts and wastes of methamphetamine production are inherently dangerous and injurious to the public health safety and welfare of the citizens of the city regulation of the sale of the chemical precursors to methamphetamine production  namely ephedrine products and pseudoephedrine products is necessary to protect the citizens of the city  21511   definitions for the purposes of this chapter the following words and phrases shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them by this section ephedrine means all forms of ephedrine ephedrine hydrochloride and all combinations of these chemicals and any methamphetamine precursor drug containing these chemicals methamphetamine precursor drug means any drug or substance as described in the revised statutes of missouri person means any individual corporation partnership trust limited liability company firm association or other entity pseudoephedrine means all forms of pseudoephedrine pseudoephedrine hydrochloride and all combinations of these chemicals and any methamphetamine precursor drug containing these chemicals  21511   prohibition of sale of methamphetamine precursor drugs it shall be illegal for any person to sell deliver or distribute ephedrine pseudoephedrine or any other methamphetamine precursor drugs except as set forth in the specific exceptions contained in this chapter  21511   exceptions a ephedrine pseudoephedrine or other methamphetamine precursor drugs may be sold by a missouri licensed pharmacist after being authorized to do so by a written prescription from a physician or other healthcare professional licensed by the state of missouri to write prescriptions b ephedrine pseudoephedrine or other methamphetamine precursor drugs may be distributed by a licensed physician within the physicians office clinic nursing home or other licensed healthcare facility c this chapter regulating ephedrine pseudoephedrine or other methamphetamine precursor drugs shall not apply to the sale of animal feed containing ephedrine or dietary supplement products containing naturally occurring or herbal ephedra or extracts of herbal ephedra  21511   products not convertible to methamphetamine ephedrine or pseudoephedrine products manufactured in a manner so as to prevent the conversion of the product to methamphetamine shall be exempt from this chapter any person selling ephedrine or pseudoephedrine products shall have the burden of proving that the product cannot be converted to methamphetamine as an example zephrexd has been shown to be such a product and shall be exempt from this chapter  2513   prima facie evidence it shall be prima facie proof that a substance is regulated by this chapter if the substance is contained in its original packaging and is labeled as being ephedrine pseudoephedrine or other methamphetamine precursor drugs  21511   reporting theft of methamphetamine precursor drugs a all thefts shortages disappearances miscounts or other losses of ephedrine pseudoephedrine or other methamphetamine precursor drugs shall be reported to the police department of the city within twentyfour 24 hours of discovery b any person selling ephedrine pseudoephedrine or other methamphetamine precursor drugs shall report any difference between the quantity of the aforementioned drugs shipped and the quantity received to the police department of the city within twentyfour 24 hours of discovery  21511   injunctive relief the city may seek injunctive relief against any person who is in violation of this chapter  21511   penalty each violation of this chapter shall be considered a separate offense violation of this chapter shall be punished under this code  21511 theft and related offenses stealing a as used in this section private property is a blighting factor which not only depreciates the value of the property which has been the target of such malicious vandalism but also depreciates the value of the adjacent and surrounding properties and in so doing negatively impacts upon the entire community the city has in the past undertaken to remove graffiti from public property but has been unable to mount a successful program for encouraging the owners of private property to undertake to remove graffiti and other inscribed materials from walls structures etc the legislation of the state of missouri has authorized the city to define regulate suppress and prevent nuisance and to declare what shall constitute a nuisance and to abate and remove the same    legislative determination a the board of aldermen finds and determines that graffiti is a nuisance and unless it and other inscribed material is removed from public and private properties it tends to remain  and other properties are then in the target of the graffiti with the result that entire neighborhoods and indeed the community is depreciated in value and made a less desirable place to be the board of aldermen therefore determines that it is appropriate that the city develop procedures to implement an ordinance and to provide for the removal of graffiti and other inscribed material from both public and private property under the circumstances set forth hereinafter b the board of aldermen declares as a matter of legislative determination that 1 the increasing incidents of the defacement of public and private property application of graffiti upon walls rocks bridges buildings fences gates other structures trees and other real and personal property within the corporate boundaries of the city constitutes a blight on this community and in the interests of the health safety and general welfare of the residents and taxpayers of the city immediate steps must be taken to remove this blight  2 when appropriate the courts should require those who commit acts of defacement of public or private property application of graffiti to restore the property so defaced damaged or destroyed  3 obtaining convictions for the application of graffiti is difficult to the fact that the offense can be committed so very quickly and secretively that witnesses to the act are frequently nonexistent  4 the schools should be encouraged to cooperate in the elimination of graffiti by reporting to the proper authorities the incidents of the application of graffiti which thereof observe    definitions whenever the following terms are used in this chapter they shall have the meaning established by this section graffiti means the defacing damaging or destroying by spraying of paint or marking of ink chalk dye or other similar substances on public and private buildings structures and places graffiti abatement procedure means an abatement procedure which identifies graffiti issues notice to the landowner to abate the graffiti and cures in absence of response private contractor means any person with whom the city shall have duly contracted to remove graffiti    graffiti prohibited it is unlawful for any person to write paint or draw upon any wall rock bridge building fence gate other structure tree or other real or personal property either publicly or privately owned any drawing inscription figure or mark of the type which is commonly known and referred to as graffiti within the city    violationpenalty any person who is convicted of violating this chapter shall be punished by a fine of not exceeding five hundred dollars $50000 or by imprisonment not to exceed three months or both such fine and imprisonment in addition to such punishment the court may in imposing the sentence order the defendant to restore the property so defaced damaged or destroyed amended during 406 supplement  prior code  1764   notice of removal whenever the public works director or hisher designated representative determines that graffiti exists on any public and private buildings structures and places which are visible to any person utilizing any public rightofway in this city be this road parkway alley or otherwise and that seasonal temperatures permit the painting of exterior surfaces the public works director or hisher designated representative shall cause a notice to be issued to abate such nuisance the property owner shall have fifteen 15 days after the date of the notice to remove the graffiti or the same will be subject to abatement by the city the notice to abate graffiti pursuant to this section shall cause a written notice to be served upon the owners of the affected premises as such owners name and address appears on the last property tax assessment rolls of the county of perry if there is no known address for the owner the notice shall be sent in care of the property address the notice required by this section may be served in any one of the following manners a by personal service on the owner occupant or person in charge or control of the property  b by registered or certified mail addressed to the owner at the last known address of said owner if this address is unknown the notice will be sent to the property address the notice shall be substantially in the following form notice of intent to remove graffiti date notice is hereby given that you are required by law at your expense to remove or paint over the graffiti located on the property commonly known as ___________ perryville missouri which is visible to public view within fifteen 15 days after the date of this notice  or if you fail to do so city employees or private contractors employed by the city will enter upon your property and abate the public nuisance by removal or painting over the graffiti the cost of abatement by the city employees or its private contractors will be assessed upon your property and such costs will constitute a lien upon the land until paid all persons having any objection to or interest in said matters are hereby notified to submit any objections or comments to the public works director of the city of perryville or hisher designated representatives within five 5 days from the date of this notice at the conclusion of this fifteen 15 day period the city may proceed with the abatement of the graffiti inscribed on your property at your expense without further notice    citys costs declared lien any and all costs incurred by the city in the abatement of the graffiti nuisance under the provisions of this chapter may constitute a lien against the property upon which such nuisance existed    appeal within ten days from the mailing or personal service of the notice the owner or person occupying or controlling such premises or lot affected may appeal to the city administrator    removal by city upon failure of persons to comply with the notice by the designated date or such continued date thereafter as the public works director or hisher designated representative approves then the public works director is authorized and directed to cause the graffiti to be abated by city forces or private contract and the city or its private dealer warehouseman or repairman  fair housing code short title this chapter shall be known as the fair housing code    definitions as used in this chapter the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them  means this chapter city administrator means the city administrator of the city of perryville missouri discriminatory housing practices means acts that are unlawful under dwelling means any building structure or portion thereof located within the city which is occupied as or designed or intended for occupancy as residence by one or more families and any vacant land which is offered for sale or lease for the construction or location thereon of any such building structure or portion thereof family includes a single individual persons includes one or more individuals corporations partnerships associations labor organizations legal representatives mutual companies jointstock companies trusts unincorporated organizations trustees trustees in bankruptcy receivers and fiduciaries renting includes to lease to sublease to let and otherwise to grant for a consideration the right to occupy premises not owned by the occupant    the city administrator shall have the authority and responsibility for administering this code the administrator shall administer the code in an affirmative manner to further the policies of the code and to prevent or eliminate discriminatory housing practices the city administrator shall cooperate with and render technical assistance state and local public and private agencies organizations and institutions which are formulated to or carry out programs to prevent or eliminate discriminatory housing practices    acts constituting discrimination in the sale or rental of housing except as exempted by it is unlawful for any person a to refuse to sell or rent after the making of a bona fide offer or to refuse to negotiate for the sale or rental of or otherwise make unavailable or deny a dwelling to any persons because of race color religion religious affiliation sex national origin ancestry marital status familial status or handicap  b to discriminate against any person in the terms conditions or privileges of sale or rental of a dwelling or in the provision of services or facilities in connection therewith because of race color religion religious affiliation sex national origin ancestry marital status familial status or handicap  c to make print or publish or cause to be made printed or published any notice statement or advertisement with respect to the sale or rental of a dwelling that indicates any preference limitation or discrimination based on race color religion religious affiliation sex national origin ancestry marital status familial status or handicap or any intention to make any such preference limitation or discrimination  d to represent to any persons because of race color religion religious affiliation sex national origin ancestry marital status familial status or handicap that any dwelling is not available for inspection sale or rental when such dwelling is in fact so available  e for profit to induce or attempt to induce any persons to sell or rent any dwelling by representations regarding the entry or prospective entry into the neighborhood of a person or persons of a particular race color religion religious affiliation sex national origin ancestry marital status familial status or handicap  f to discriminate in the sale or rental of housing on the basis of a handicap design and construction of new family dwellings with four or more units shall meet the adaptability and accessibility requirements of the americans with disabilities act of 1990 42 usc 121 et seq and regulations adopted pursuant thereto    discrimination in the financing of housing it is unlawful for any bank building and loan association insurance company or other corporation association firm or enterprise whose business consists in whole or in part in the making of commercial real estate loans to deny a loan or other financial assistance to a person applying therefore for the purpose of purchasing constructing improving repairing or maintaining a dwelling or to complaintinvestigationhearingenforcement a any person who claims to have been injured by a discriminatory housing practice or who believes that he will be irrevocably injured by a discriminatory housing practice that is about to occur hereafter called the person aggrieved may file a complaint with the city administrator complaints shall be in writing and shall contain such information and be in such form as the city administrator may require upon receipt of a complaint a copy shall be furnished to the person who allegedly committed or is about to commit the alleged discriminatory housing practice b the city administrator or his designate upon receipt of a complaint from an injured person shall advise the person of his right to contact the united states department of housing and urban development and the method by which the injured person may do so c within thirty 30 days after receiving a complaint it shall be investigated and the city administrator shall determine if cause exists for the allegations made in the complaint the city administrator may request the assistance of the city attorney in his investigations if the city administrator finds cause for the complaint he shall attempt to eliminate or correct the alleged discriminatory housing practice by informal methods of conference conciliation and persuasion the complaint shall be dismissed if the city administrator finds no cause d if the city administrator at any time has reason to believe that any person has been engaged in discriminatory practices prohibited by this code he may issue a complaint e a complaint under subsection a of this section shall be filed within one hundred eighty 180 days after the alleged discriminatory housing practice occurred complaints may be reasonably and fairly amended at any time f a respondent may file an answer to the complaint against him and with the leave of the city administrator which shall be granted whenever it would be reasonable and fair to do so may amend his answer at any time both complaints and answers shall be verified g should the city administrator find that an unfair housing practice has been committed in violation of this chapter he may enter the appropriate order and shall thereafter cause such order to be served on all parties in the event the parties fail to comply with said order the city shall prosecute any violation upon conviction the guilty party shall be penalized as made and provided in    appeals to applicable federal or state agencies or courts any person aggrieved by any decision finding or order issued by the city administrator under this chapter may appeal to the us department of housing and urban development or any other applicable federal or state agency or court  title 10  vehicles and traffic chapters 31814 state law reference see rsmo     leaving the scene of a motor vehicle accident a a person commits the offense of leaving the scene of a motor vehicle accident when being the operator or driver of a vehicle on the highway or on any public or privately owned parking lot or parking facility generally open for use by the public and knowing that the injury has been caused to a person or damage has been caused to property due to his culpability or to accident he leaves the place of injury damage or accident without stopping and giving his name residence including city and street number motor vehicle number and chauffeurs or registered operators number if any to the injured party or to a police officer or if no police officer is in the vicinity then to the nearest police station or judicial officer b for the purpose of this section all peace officers shall have jurisdiction when invited by the injured person to enter the premises of any privately owned parking lot or parking facility for the purposes of investigating an accident and performing all necessary duties regarding such an accident    vehicles to be driven on right half of roadway upon all public roads or highways of sufficient width a vehicle shall be driven upon the right half of the roadway except as follows a when overtaking and passing another vehicle proceeding in the same direction under the rules governing such movement  b when placing a vehicle in position for and when such vehicle is lawfully making a left turn  c when the right half of a roadway is closed to traffic while under construction or repair  d upon a roadway designated by markings or signs for oneway traffic    following too closely the driver of a vehicle shall not follow another vehicle more closely than is reasonably safe and prudent having due regard for the speed of such vehicle and the traffic upon and the condition of the roadway    hand and mechanical signals a no person shall stop or suddenly decrease the speed of or turn a vehicle from a direct course or move right or left upon a roadway unless and until such movement can be made with reasonable safety and then only after the giving of an appropriate signal in the following manner 1 any driver when stopping or when checking the speed of his vehicle if the movement of other vehicles may reasonably be affected by such checking of speed shall extend his arm at any angle below horizontal so that the same may be seen in the rear of his vehicle 2 any driver intending to turn his vehicle to the right shall extend his arm at an angle above horizontal so that the same may be seen in the front of and in the rear of his vehicle and shall slow down and approach the intersecting highway as near as practical to the right side of the highway along which he is proceeding before turning 3 any driver intending to turn his vehicle to the left shall extend his arm in a horizontal position so that the same may be seen in the rear of his vehicle and shall slow down and approach the intersecting highway so that the left side of his vehicle shall be as near as practical to the center line of the highway along which he is proceeding before turning b the signals required by this section shall be given either by means of the hand and arm or by a signal light or signal device in good mechanical condition of a type approved by the state highway patrol  provided however that when a vehicle is so constructed or so loaded that a handandarm signal would not be visible both to the front and rear of such vehicle then such signals shall be given by such light or device    unattended motor vehicle no person shall leave a motor vehicle unattended on the highway without first stopping the motor and cutting off the electric current storage while so impounded and court costs and fines assessed or upon posting of a bond or bonds if such motor vehicle is not reclaimed and all of the costs of impoundment paid within ninety 90 days used in this chapter sinkhole means any opening crevice or other depression in the surface or below the surface of the earth stormwater means that portion of the rainfall or other precipitation which runs off over the surface during a storm and for such a short period following a storm as the flow exceeds the normal or ordinary runoff surface water means that portion of rainfall or other precipitation which runs off over the surface of the ground watercourse means land which has a conformation so as to give surface water flowing from one tract of land to another tract of land a fixed and determinate course so as to uniformly discharge it upon the servient tract at a fixed and definite point it includes but is not limited to ravines swales sinkholes or depressions of greater or lesser depth extending from one tract and so situated as to gather up the surface water flowing upon dominant tract and to conduct along a definite course to a definite point of discharge upon servient tract it shall not be deemed to be important that the force of the water flowing from one tract of land to another has not been sufficient to wear out a channel or canal having definite or wellmarked sides or banks if the surface water in fact uniformly or habitually flows over a given course having reasonable limits as to the width of the line of its flow it shall be considered to have a definite course 21   obstruction of watercourses and sinkholes prohibited it is unlawful for any person to block obstruct destroy cover fill or alter in any way a watercourse or sinkhole or any part thereof so as to cause damage to the property of other persons from surface water 22   violationpublic nuisance a violation of be deemed to be a public nuisance as well as a misdemeanor whenever the city engineer or city administrator has determined that a person has blocked obstructed destroyed covered filled or altered in any way a watercourse or sinkhole so as to cause surface water damage to the property of others the city engineer or city administrator is authorized to proceed in accordance with so as to abate the public nuisance the city engineer or city administrator shall proceed in accordance with the authority granted to and as though the city engineer or city administrator was the city health officer under in ordering such nuisance abated 23   building permitsissuance whenever the zoning administrator building inspector or city engineer of the city has reason to believe that work performed pursuant to a building permit may be in an area defined as a watercourse or sinkhole or that work performed pursuant to a building permit may in some way interfere with the use and operation of a watercourse or sinkhole or may violate the provisions of the zoning administrator building inspector or city engineer before issuing or consenting to a building permit shall refer the request for a building permit to the city administration for approval upon the matter being referred to the city administrator the city administrator shall determine whether or not the work performed pursuant to the building permit will interfere with the use and operation of the watercourse or sinkhole the city administrator may require the person requesting the building permit to submit information to the city administrator concerning the capacity of the watercourse or sinkhole the amount of surface water runoff in the drainage area and the amount of surface water runoff that would be caused by the issuance of the building permit the city administrator before approving the request shall determine whether or not the applicant has made adequate provisions for surface water runoff so that the project will not interfere with the use and operation of a watercourse or sinkhole except nothing contained herein shall be construed to prohibit the altering of a watercourse so long as it is done pursuant to a permit and provided the change does not cause damage to others or creates a condition which could cause damage to others in the opinion of the administrator the permit may be conditioned upon compliance with standards established by the administrator so as to protect public health safety and welfare so as to insure the project will not interfere with the use of the watercourse or sinkhole and that adequate provisions are made to protect the watercourse or sinkhole from any work being performed pursuant to the building permit in the event the city administrator determines that the permit cannot be issued because the city administrator has determined that the applicant cannot meet the condition or has refused to meet the condition the applicant shall be notified in writing and given an opportunity to present alternative plans to protect the watercourse or sinkhole or to guarantee that the work will not interfere with the use of the watercourse or sinkhole in the event the applicant is aggrieved by the decision of the city administrator the applicant shall have the right to appeal the city administrators decision to the board of aldermen except no permit shall be issued unless the applicant can show that the provisions of this chapter will not be violated the permit shall also provide that the applicant cannot block obstruct destroy cover fill or alter in any way whatsoever a watercourse or sinkhole so as to cause damage to adjoining property from surface water and that in the event it is determined that adjoining property is damaged the authority to perform work pursuant to the building permit shall be null and void 24   posting of land it is unlawful for any person to block obstruct destroy cover fill or alter in any way a watercourse or sinkhole when the watercourse or sinkhole has been posted by the city in accordance with the procedures established in this chapter when the city administrator has determined that a person is blocking obstructing destroying covering filling or altering a watercourse or sinkhole which in the opinion of the city administrator will now or in the future cause damage to adjoining property the city administrator is authorized to post private property which posting shall clearly designate that the blocking obstructing destroying covering filling or altering in any way is prohibited the city administrator shall give notice to the owner of the property pursuant to the provisions set forth in that it is unlawful for any person to fill block obstruct cover destroy or in any way alter the watercourse or sinkhole when the city administrator has determined that the damage to adjoining property might reasonably be caused now or in the future by such actions the owner of the property may request a hearing before the city administrator at which time the owner shall submit information pertaining to drainage as described in the owner may request a hearing in front of the city administrator and the owner shall at that time submit evidence concerning the surface water runoff in the area and his plans for the watercourse in the event the city administrator determines that the owners plans for the watercourse will not cause damage to adjoining property owners the city administrator shall cause the order prohibiting the blocking obstructing destroying filling covering or altering to be removed adjoining property owners shall be notified of any hearing held in front of the city administrator and such property owner may appear in the matter to be heard in the event the city administrator determines that no further blocking obstructing filling covering or altering of the watercourse can be permitted the city administrator shall enter into an order so stating the owner of the property for which a notice has been issued may appeal the decision of the city administrator under this section pursuant to the provisions of the administrative procedure act 25   obstructing drainage any person who shall destroy tear up or otherwise injure or fill up or otherwise obstruct any sewer gutter trench or channel dug made or used for the purpose of carrying off water from or draining any street within the city shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor 26   sinkhole remediation and management a remediation and management the city shall accept responsibility for the remediation and management of sinkholes for which it has been granted a permanent easement by the property owner under the terms and conditions set forth in this section b developed property the owner of a developed lot may apply to the city and request that the city accept responsibility for remediation and management of the sinkhole on said developed lot if the city accepts said responsibility then it shall design and construct the sinkhole improvement features the property owner shall grant to the city an easement of a size no less than fifty 50 feet by fifty 50 feet square centered on the center of the sinkhole or the standpipe designed by the city the property owner shall also grant an easement for ingress and egress to the sinkhole easement the city shall only be responsible for the maintenance of the sinkhole utility designed and installed by it  all mowing surface debris removal and other aesthetic maintenance shall be the responsibility of the property owner c undeveloped property the owner of any undeveloped property shall be responsible for constructing sinkhole improvement features in a manner approved by the city prior to the development of the property after the sinkhole improvement is constructed and installed the owner of the undeveloped property may apply to the city and request that the city accept responsibility for remediation and management of the sinkhole on said undeveloped property if the city accepts said responsibility the property owner shall grant to the city an easement of a size no less than fifty 50 feet by fifty 50 feet square centered on the center of the standpipe constructed and installed unless the city determines that the property is used for agricultural purposes in that event the minimum easement size shall be one hundred 100 feet by one hundred 100 feet square centered on the center of the standpipe constructed and installed the property owner shall also grant an easement for ingress and egress to the sinkhole easement the city shall only be responsible for the maintenance of the sinkhole utility constructed by the property owner and accepted by the city  all mowing surface debris removal and other aesthetic maintenance shall be the responsibility of the property owner d partially developed property upon being notified that a sinkhole exists on what the city determines to be a partially developed property the city may agree to enter into a cost share agreement with the property owner in order to construct sinkhole improvement features if the city accepts said responsibility the city shall provide the design of the sinkhole improvement and the labor and equipment necessary to improve the sinkhole the property owner shall pay for all materials necessary to construct the sinkhole improvement the city may in its sole discretion determine that the sinkhole improvement will be constructed by private contractors in that event the property owner shall pay fifty 50 percent of the cost of constructing the sinkhole improvement at the citys sole discretion the property owners share of the cost of constructing the sinkhole improvement may be covered by the issuance of a special tax bill against the property upon which the sinkhole improvement is made and such special tax bill shall become a lien on the property in the same manner as provided elsewhere in this code for special tax bills the property owner shall grant to the city an easement of a size no less than fifty 50 feet by fifty 50 feet square centered on the center of the standpipe constructed and installed unless the city determines that the property is used for agricultural purposes in that event the minimum easement size shall be one hundred 100 feet by one hundred 100 feet square centered on the center of the standpipe constructed and installed the property owner shall also grant an easement for ingress and egress to the sinkhole easement the city shall only be responsible for the maintenance of the sinkhole utility constructed  all mowing surface debris removal and other aesthetic maintenance shall be the responsibility of the property owner  62513   sinkhole improvement plan a policy statement sinkholes provide a vital stormwater function within the city of perryville the karst topography of the area is very prone to sinkholes and it is the responsibility of the city to enforce proper sinkhole maintenance and development to best protect the citizens property and environment the goal is not to develop every sinkhole within the city but only those deemed necessary by the city this policy shall serve to guide that improvement b preferred sinkhole improvement method the citys typical sinkhole improvement process consists of excavating the depression and removing any debris eg trash soil mud gravel etc present to expose the crevice or opening in the bedrock of the karst subsurface system ideally the crevice is excavated completely and a vertical standpipe a fortyeight 48 inch diameter precast concrete manhole preferred is installed over the crevice any portions of the crevice that extend beyond the edge of the standpipe are grouted with lowslump concrete to effectively prevent groundwater from penetrating the crevice except opening within the standpipe the standpipe is extended to the existing or proposed final ground elevation and the structure backfilled with graded crushed rock and compacted earth the area around the standpipe is graded to allow surface runoff to drain into the standpipe opening the standpipe shall be covered with a trash rack or other suitable grated intake to help ensure safety and prevent larger debris from entering the standpipe wherever possible the area immediately surrounding the improved sinkhole is established as a vegetated buffer as a means of filtration to prevent sediment and other contaminants from entering the standpipe the city shall acquire a permanent easement for perpetual maintenance of the improved sinkhole as set forth in in general the agricultural areas within the city limits will minimally require a 50foot easement measured from the center of the standpipe to be used as a vegetative buffer area in other areas within the city limits the preferred easement and vegetative buffer area will minimally be a 25foot radius measured from the center of the standpipe it may be possible to reduce this vegetative buffer provided property owners apply herbicide in strict accordance with the instructions found on the label maintaining appropriate set back requirements while also keeping in mind any aquatic life restrictions sinkhole improvement details at f c alternative sinkhole improvement methods each sinkhole improvement is unique due to variables such as the crevice depth and geometry surface runoff drainage area and the location of the sinkhole relative to existing and proposed developments it may be necessary to take a customized approach on a specific sinkhole improvement and assess various design alternatives these alternate approaches to improving the sinkhole may include but are not limited to the following 1 using a smaller diameter standpipe if the surface drainage area is small andor if access to the crevice by a person is not necessary 2 if the sinkhole location does not allow for the preferred buffer and with the approval of the city storm water runoff can be directed to a sedimentation or detention basin upstream of the sinkhole standpipe mechanical filters upstream of the piping connection to the standpipe may be utilized or other suitable methods to improve surface runoff water quality may be used with the approval of the city d temporary best management practices prior to during and after sinkholes are improved it is important that any necessary best management practices bmps are utilized when construction or land disturbance activities are performed within the watershed of a particular sinkhole when any activities are performed upstream of the sinkhole that may induce sedimentation and pollution of surface water runoff siltation and erosion control methods shall be installed additionally any work on or in the immediate vicinity of the sinkhole shall be performed with siltation and erosion control measures in place and shall be timed with concern for weather conditions to minimize the possibility of sedimentation and polluted runoff from entering the sinkhole e permanent best management practices after sinkholes are improved it is important that any necessary best management practices bmps are implemented the primary bmp for surface water runoff quality shall be the vegetated buffer or alternatively a sedimentation or detention basin mechanical filters or other method as approved by the city sinkholes will be inspected regularly and vegetated buffers shall be maintained by mowing or trimming methods rather than using chemical treatment grass clippings or other debris shall be kept clear from the standpipe opening f sinkhole development details editors note on following page municipal airport consent to ordinances any person making use of the perryville municipal airport or grounds owned by the city adjacent thereto or found thereon or being thereon shall be held to have businesses shall be in full force and effect at the airport and its property adjacent to it owned by the city    promulgation of rules and regulations the city administrator or his designate with the missouri it shall be unlawful for any person to begin any excavation in or on any privately held property within the limits of the city any public or private street road or alley rightofway dedicated to the public use utility easement of record or prescriptive easement without first giving notice of intent to excavate an excavator shall serve notice of intent to excavate in the manner and form required by rsmo and any amendment thereto b for the purpose of this chapter excavation shall mean any operation in which earth rock or other material in or on the ground is moved removed or otherwise displaced by means of any tools equipment or explosives and includes without being limited to backfilling grading scraping cable or pipe plowing plowingin  pullingin ripping driving and demolition of structures except that the use of mechanized tools and equipment to break and remove pavement and masonry down only to the depth of such pavement or masonry the use of highvelocity air to disintegrate and suction to remove earth rock and other materials and the tilling of soil for agricultural or seeding purposes shall not be deemed excavation backfilling or moving earth on the ground in connection with other excavation operations at the same site shall not be deemed separate instances of excavation c any violation of this section is unlawful and shall be punished under of this code d in addition to any criminal penalty any individual firm corporation or entity that violates the provisions of this section shall be liable to the owners of any underground facility damaged by the unlawful excavation for the fair and reasonable expenses incurred in repairing or replacing the damaged facilities in addition they shall be liable to the owners of any other underground facilities for the costs incurred incidentally due to repair of the damaged facilities including without limitation and by way of example only emergency locates overtime compensation and excavation an action for damages under this section may be filed in any court of competent jurisdiction  9710   underground facility safety and damage prevention the state of missouri has implemented the underground facility installation regardless of whether said installation is to be completed by the contractor or the property owner precise location coordinates and asbuilt drawings for all underground facilities shall lines in the trench alongside the pipe the trace wire shall be in accordance with the citys trace wire specification document c the trace wire shall be twelve 12 gauge minimum and run continuously without splices for the full length of the service line from the building to the water sewer or natural gas main if splicing is necessary a direct bury splice kit is required in accordance with the citys trace wire specification document d the trace wire shall daylight at the point of entry at the foundation of the building conduit and be permanently attached to a test station as a future contact point to locate the service the test station shall be in accordance with the citys trace wire specification document e the trace wire shall be installed on all new water main installations in the streetroadway and shall come to the surface at every fire hydrant for termination in accordance with the citys trace wire specification document f in some circumstances the public works department andor building official may also require trace wire be extended to curb boxes cleanouts gutter drains fire hydrants or other similar underground infrastructure in accordance with the citys trace wire uscunited states   8211   purpose the purpose of this title is to provide for better water and sewer service to protect the public health and welfare by abating the pollution of water to create means for a continued supply of wholesome water and to meet the demands of an expanding city as authorized and directed by the laws of this state and the rules and regulations of the united states department of health and welfare and the division of health of missouri    waterworks and sewerage system combined the waterworks system and the sewerage system owned and operated by the city are combined and declared to be one municipal utility together with all future improvements or extensions whether to the waterworks or to the sewerage system or to both and shall be operated and maintained as one unit as provided by state law    financing cost of combined system the cost to the city for acquiring constructing improving or extending its combined waterworks and sewerage system may be met as follows a through the expenditure of any city funds available for that purpose  b from the issuance of bonds for that purpose payable from taxes to be levied by the city  c from the proceeds of special assessments levied and collected according to state law  d from any other funds which may be obtained under any law of this state or of the united states for that purpose  e from the proceeds of revenue bonds of the city payable solely from the revenues to be derived from the operation of the combined waterworks and sewerage system or from any combination of any or all of such methods of providing funds    charges to be made in relation to combined system rates authorized to be fixed and charged by this title shall be fixed and charged to all parts of the combined waterworks and sewerage system regardless of whether or not the services of the system shall previously have been rendered without charge therefor by the citys previously existing waterworks system sewerage system or combined waterworks and sewerage system and regardless of how the acquisition of such system shall have been financed whether by taxation special assessment the issuance of bonds or otherwise    ownership of equipment installed by city all equipment furnished or installed by the city at its own expense shall remain the property of the city    service installations and apparatusconsumer responsibility customers utilizing a oneinch meter or less shall be responsible for the installation of the service line from the city main to the premises of customer the city assumes ownership of said service line from the city main to a point one foot past the meter box repair and maintenance of the service line from that point to the premises is the responsibility of the under the jurisdiction of the city any sewage industrial wastes or other polluted waters except where suitable treatment has been provided in accordance with the provisions of this chapter    pollution of groundwater sources it is unlawful for any person to pollute groundwater sources by discharging sewage into any well cistern spring sinkhole cave mine shaft tunnel pit quarry or other excavation or into any fissure or crevice leading to underground waterbearing strata    consumer questions and complaints all questions and complaints within the scope of this chapter including any disrespect or unwarranted act of employees of the waterworks and sewerage system shall be reported promptly to the water and sewerage department of the city in order that an investigation can be made and information can be properly given the city shall make a full report to the consumer in all such cases    acceptance of tips by employees all employees of the waterworks and sewerage system are strictly forbidden to demand or accept any tip gratuity or other personal compensation in the performance of their duties    water sewer and stormwater manhole standardization a all manholes which are apparatus  2000 prior code  2828   right of city to demand repairs charges and removal of apparatus the city shall have the right and option to demand charges or stopping of use of water or to require any repair change removal or improvement of any pipe fixture plumbing or other apparatus that would in any manner affect the satisfactory operation of the water or sanitary sewer system and treatment facilities    right of city to shut off water in main the city reserves the right at all times without notice to any customer to shut off the water in a main for the purpose making repairs or extensions or for any other necessary purpose all persons having boilers or tanks within their premises depending on the pressure from the main to keep them filled are cautioned against the danger of collapse it is the intention of the city to notify its customers of the necessity of shutting off the main supply but an emergency may at times not permit taking the time to do so    right of city to refuse or discontinue water service when system endangeredrepair and removal of apparatus the city shall have the right to refuse or to discontinue water service without notice at any time to any consumer if the city finds any apparatus or appliance which will be detrimental to the water system of the city or to any or all of its consumers standpipes hydrants gate valves and any other apparatus that cause any danger to the water system or any other customers plumbing shall be immediately repaired or removed upon notice from the city or at its option the city may immediately discontinue service without notice and without any liability for direct or resulting damages therefrom    right of city to discontinue service upon violation upon violation of any provision of this chapter or any other rule and regulation of the city by a consumer the right is reserved by the city after due notice has been given to discontinue service to such consumer    contractor protestprocedure the board of aldermen establishes the following procedures for prompt consideration of initial protests filed by contractors or subcontractors concerning the solicitations or contract awards for construction of city projects including public water system improvements as follows a a protest is a written complaint concerning the citys solicitation or award of a subagreement or contract which must be filed in writing with the city clerk by a party with a direct financial interest adversely affected by the citys procurement action for construction of public water supply improvements b a party with a financial interest which believes it is adversely affected by a procurement action by the city must file a written protest stating the basis for such protest with the city clerk as early in the procurement process as possible a protest must be received by the clerk within seven days after the basis for the protest is known or reasonably should have been known the board of aldermen upon receipt of such protest shall hold a hearing as soon as reasonably possible or proper and legal notification to the party with the financial interest which is allegedly adversely affected by the action of the city and that such protestant shall be accorded a complete hearing and shall have the right to adduce evidence both verbal and documentary to the board of aldermen and upon conclusion of the hearing and the evidence adduced as submitted the board of aldermen shall announce and issue its written decision and order making disposition of the issues raised in such protest a written copy of the decision of the board of aldermen shall be served upon the protestant within seven days after the hearing c the provisions of this section shall be incorporated in any solicitations contract awards or subagreements entered into by the city  2000 water and sewer rates and charges water service rates a rate schedules for the cost of water to city water developments the board of aldermen shall also have the right to authorize extensions to be constructed by persons at their own expense or with their own employees providing that the materials and damage    backfilling service line trench a all service line trenches on or across any street alley public thoroughfare or driveway shall be backfilled in the following manner 1 all trenches on or across any improved or surfaced street alley public thoroughfare or driveway shall be kept to the narrowest width practical for the installation of the service line all excavated material shall be removed and disposed of and the trench shall be backfilled with an approved granular material the backfill material shall be thoroughly compacted in a manner approved by the public works director the area excavated shall be replaced with the same type of material as the preexisting surface if the surface is bituminous material it shall be replaced with a minimum thickness of four inches of an approved bituminous patch material thoroughly compacted so as to provide a smooth surface 2 all that portion of the trench outside the surfaced area of any street alley thoroughfare or driveway shall be backfilled with the excavated material being thoroughly compacted in a manner approved by the public works director after such trench has been completely backfilled all excess and unsatisfactory material shall be disposed of and the area of operations shall be cleaned and dressed approved granular material may be used for backfilling this area without tamping to within six inches of the surface the balance of the trench to be backfilled with earth in the parkway and grassway areas and with crushed stone or earth in the other areas b no service line trench shall be backfilled until after the tap has been completed and the installation has been approved by the city   8211   excavations to be guarded all excavations for water service connections shall be adequately guarded with copper tracer wire if the polyethylene tubing is connected to a plastic water main the tracer wire shall be soldered to the tracer wire on the water main or connected to the tracer wire on the water main using a testing agency listed direct burial splice kit if the polyethylene tubing is connected to a ductile iron water main the tracer wire shall be soldered to the tapping saddle or connected to inches in diameter shall be ductile iron meeting the latest accepted specifications of the american waterworks association class 150 or u s government specification type k copper tubing or main the tracer wire shall be soldered to the tracer wire on the water main or connected to the tracer wire on the water main using a testing agency listed direct burial splice kit if the polyethylene tubing is connected to a ductile iron water main the tracer wire shall be soldered to the tapping saddle or connected to the tapping saddle using a testing agency listed direct burial splice kit polyethylene tubing shall be blue in color and suitable for potable water d all service pipes greater than two inches in diameter shall be ductile iron meeting the latest accepted specifications of the american waterworks association class 150 or type k hard copper tubing or polyvinyl chloride pvc class 900 905 or 909 e all pipe described herein shall be rated at one hundred fifty 150 psi or questionable character or which is another water supply approved by the state division of health or the state water pollution board other than the city if such a crossconnection is found the city installation the consumer shall keep his service pipes free from leaks at all times where a leak appears in a consumers installation allowing water to escape that does not register the city shall give the consumer written notice thereof and the consumer shall immediately proceed to repair such service pipe if the same is not repaired within fortyeight 48 hours after written notice has been given to the consumer the city may discontinue the service by closing the corporation stop the cost of excavating and shutting off such service shall be paid by the consumer or by the owner of the property on which the service pipes are located before the service shall be restored by the city if in the judgment of the city any leak on the consumers installation is of such nature as to endanger public safety or constitute a nuisance or is the source of the waste of any considerable amount of water the city may cut off or discontinue such service without previous notice to the consumer and shall not restore service until such leak is repaired   8211   abandoned service pipes should an owner desire to abandon the service pipes the owner shall uncover and expose the corporation stop so that provided the city has access during business hours   8211   81914   yoke an iron meter yoke with a lockable shutoff valve and check valve shall be installed in the meter tile which shall be located at or near the customers property line such yoke is to be furnished and installed by the customers plumber and shall be an approved type   8211   meter reading conclusiveexceptions all customers shall be liable for the water consumption as shown by the meter whether used wasted or caused by leakage or otherwise  provided however that whenever the city finds any meter not registering an average bill may be rendered at the sole discretion of the city this average bill shall be based upon a timeframe that most accurately reflects recent usage patterns andor previous usage history whenever the city has reason to believe that any water meter is not registering correctly such average bill may be rendered and the meter removed for testing  if such average bill proves to be incorrectly estimated either by actual test or by actual water consumption after being replaced by a correct meter such average bill so rendered shall be revised to conform to the same   8211   moving of meters a any customer may make arrangements to move their water meter to a location which shall comply with such customer shall file in writing with the city a request for moving the meter which request shall designate the location to which the meter is to be moved upon the receipt of such a request the building inspector shall examine the proposed location and if found to comply with this article shall issue a written permit for the meter relocation and shall furnish the applicant with a meter yoke meter tile and cover without charge such applicant shall furnish all other labor material and equipment required for moving the meter and when all of the necessary piping has been completed for the actual installation of the meter at its new location he shall notify the city which will arrange to move the meter to its new location and inspect the piping and work the citys authorized representative who moves the meter and inspects the piping and work shall make a notation on the request which has been filed by the applicant of the date the meter was moved and comments on his inspection b the charge for making the inspection required by subsection a of this section shall be twenty dollars $2000  provided however that if the service line or piping is not ready for moving the meter or is found unsatisfactory upon inspection there shall be an additional charge of twenty dollars $2000 for each additional service call required   8211   testing of meters a in the event a customer requests an accuracy test of a meter one inch or smaller the customer shall be required prior to making such test to deposit with the city an amount listed on the yearly rate schedule to cover the cost of removing testing and replacing such meter in the event such meter is found to register incorrectly by more than two percent an accurate meter shall be substituted and the test deposit shall be refunded past water bills shall be adjusted by refund or credit of such percentage of the amount of the water bills for a period of not more than two months previous to such tests in the event such meter is found to be registering correctly the customer shall forfeit the test deposit and such funds shall be deposited in the water operating funds of the city b the city shall perform accuracy tests on meters greater than one inch every five years at the citys expense if the meter falls within a five percent failure rate the customer must replace or repair the meter at customers expense   8211   reserved editors note  adopted  repealed   which pertained to customer to protect meter tampering prohibited no person without permission from the city shall tamper with any seal attached to a water meter or connect disconnect take apart or in any manner change or interfere with the action regulation or registration of a water meter or disturb any piping between any meter and the citys distributing system after such meter has been set any water meter so tampered with shall be private water supplies upon all private water supplies of sewage system customers there shall be required the installation of water meters on said supplies where the installation of a water meter is not feasible a meter shall be required to be placed on the sewer of the customer these meters shall be installed in compliance with dealing with meter installation  crossconnections   definitions as used in this article crossconnection is any physical connection between a potable water supply and any waste pipe soil pipe sewer drain or any unapproved source or system furthermore it is any potable water supply outlet which is submerged or can be submerged in wastewater andor any other source of contamination and any source or system that is in the opinion of the building inspector based on the standards of the missouri department of natural resources nonpotable and backflow can occur to contaminate the citys system bypass arrangements jumper connections removable sections swivel or changeover devices and other temporary or permanent devices or because of which backflow can occur are to be considered as crossconnections crossconnections may be considered as direct or indirect direct crossconnection is where the citys water system is physically joined to a system containing unsafe water sewage or other waste that could contaminate the safe water system indirect crossconnection may be a condition where a source of contaminated water may be blown across sucked or diverted into the citys system    violationsdiscontinuance of service crossconnections in the customers water installation are not permitted if a crossconnection is discovered the building inspector after giving the customer no less than fifteen 15 days notice of its intention will discontinue service unless the condition is corrected or an approved backflow prevention device is installed by and at the expense of the customer if in the opinion of the building inspector a real and serious threat to public health is posed the building inspector may discontinue service without notice    hazardous conditions service connections will neither be made nor allowed to continue where there is in the opinion of the building inspector a strong potential for hazardous crossconnections unless the customer will install and maintain at his own expense a backflow prevention device approved by the building inspector    backflow prevention deviceswhere required approved backflow prevention devices are required for the following facilities beverage bottling plants  ag rpd or dca packinghouses  ag or rpd cold storage plants  ag or rpd dairies  ag rpd or dca film laboratories  ag or rpd hospitals medical buildings sanitariums morgues autopsy facilities  ag or rpd nursing or convalescent homes and clinics  dca irrigation systems separate from domestic systems such as parks playgrounds cemeteries golf courses schools estates  ag or rpd lawn sprinkling systems adjunct to domestic systems  dca sewage treatment plants  ag or rpd power plants  rpd laundries lf  rpd carwashes  rpd water loading stations  ag or dca industries using toxic substances  rpd stockyards  rpd  ag refers to air gap  rpd refers to reduced pressure backflow device  dca refers to doublecheck valve assembly the building inspector at his discretion may require a device at other facilities dangerous to public health    backflow prevention devicesapproval and installation inspection backflow prevention devices shall be approved by the building inspector before installation by the customer and shall have been acceptable to the building inspector installation shall be inspected and approved by the building inspector    backflow prevention devicesmaintenance the customer shall be responsible to maintain all backflow prevention devices in good working order and to make no piping or other arrangements for bypassing the devices    backflow prevention devicesperiodic inspectiontesting periodic testing and inspection schedules shall be established by the building inspector for all backflow prevention devices inspection intervals will not exceed one year  more frequent intervals may be established in accordance with the age and condition of the device testing and inspection will be performed by a certified backflow prevention technician with cost to be borne by the customer   8211 operated by the city see also     waters no person shall discharge any stormwater groundwater roof runoff subsurface drainage ponds sump pumps septic tanks or lawn sprays into any city sanitary sewer water from swimming pools boiler drains blowoff pipes or cooling water from various equipment may be discharged into the city sanitary sewer by an indirect connection where such discharge is cooled if required and flows into the sewer at a rate not to exceed the capacity of the sewer provided the waste does not contain materials or substances in suspension or solution in violation of the terms of this chapter and provided further than cooling water from any airconditioning unit or other cooling unit shall in no event exceed onetenth of a gallon per minute per ton capacity of the air conditioner or cooling unit dilution of any water discharged into the city sanitary sewer system is prohibited whether accomplished by combining two or more streams or by adding other liquids solely for the purpose of diluting the discharge    wastewater no person shall discharge any of the following wastewater into any city sewer a any liquid or vapor having a temperature of more than one
